commit_message:
aodh-notifier: fix the launch bug

Need to call the parent class's init in aodh-notifier when we
replacing oslo.service by cotyledon, in order to make aodh-notifier to
be launched properly.

Closes-Bug: #1616760

Change-Id: I7f56ff5c60d16fb5af66e419024f2bc49c597089

subject: standardize release note page ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 20:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Clear client plugin finder methods cache
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-05 08:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/glance.py', 'heat/engine/clients/client_plugin.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_remote_stack.py', 'heat/engine/stack.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/neutron/__init__.py', 'heat/engine/clients/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Clear client plugin finder methods cache

Currently client plugin finders allows to cache finder
methods response (e.g. find_flavor_id for nova client plugin),
but after stack delete this cache behaviour is unpredictable.
Need to clear cache when deleting stack to prevent unexpected
errors.

Change-Id: Ieae35607db699c25062af530a7e3e680a51403e7
Closes-bug: #1609787
'}]
commit_message:
Clear client plugin finder methods cache

Currently client plugin finders allows to cache finder
methods response (e.g. find_flavor_id for nova client plugin),
but after stack delete this cache behaviour is unpredictable.
Need to clear cache when deleting stack to prevent unexpected
errors.

Change-Id: Ieae35607db699c25062af530a7e3e680a51403e7
Closes-bug: #1609787

subject: Disable unsupported drivers and fix DRAC dependency
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 09:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Disable unsupported drivers and fix DRAC dependency

Ironic upstream officially stopped support for drivers not covered by a third
party CI. They will be removed in Ocata.

This patch stops enabling two of these drivers, pxe_wol and pxe_amt, by default.
For Newton users can still enable them manually.

This patch also fixes incorrect dependency of pxe_drac: it no longer uses openwsman.

Change-Id: Ia1e395786c3d18d103a0ceae34e0bba92759854c
'}]
commit_message:
Disable unsupported drivers and fix DRAC dependency

Ironic upstream officially stopped support for drivers not covered by a third
party CI. They will be removed in Ocata.

This patch stops enabling two of these drivers, pxe_wol and pxe_amt, by default.
For Newton users can still enable them manually.

This patch also fixes incorrect dependency of pxe_drac: it no longer uses openwsman.

Change-Id: Ia1e395786c3d18d103a0ceae34e0bba92759854c

commit_message:
Allow deletion of multiple resources for some manila commands

Commands like
 - security-service-delete
 - share-network-delete
 - share-server-delete
 - snapshot-delete
 - snapshot-force-delete
 - type-delete

do not allow specifying more than one resource for deletion.

Add support to allow deletion of multiple resources, and add
unit tests for that.

Change-Id: I3c484bcc1fb8d5a2c31680889863403f8e58ee74
Closes-bug: #1611506

subject: can't output the debug log for freezer-scheduler
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-30 06:39:40.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/scheduler/arguments.py'], 'message': "can't output the debug log for freezer-scheduler

Edit the /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf file,
and complete the following actions:
debug = true

Restart the freezer-scheduler, no debug log available.
In the function setup_logging(), the 'freezer=INFO' should be removed
from _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS.

Change-Id: Ieeb8a7373fe9adc578decb5d3157ac22d6d41830
Partial-Bug: #1610904
"}]
commit_message:
can't output the debug log for freezer-scheduler

Edit the /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf file,
and complete the following actions:
debug = true

Restart the freezer-scheduler, no debug log available.
In the function setup_logging(), the 'freezer=INFO' should be removed
from _DEFAULT_LOG_LEVELS.

Change-Id: Ieeb8a7373fe9adc578decb5d3157ac22d6d41830
Partial-Bug: #1610904

commit_message:
Add mapping for OpenStack project names

This patch adds a new OPENSTACK_UPSTREAM_PKG_MAP map to map PyPi
names to OpenStack project names, as they are not always the same,
and a --upstream command-line argument to pymod2pkg.

Change-Id: I4eda55b4d7b2dcc8df28912913b876e2c40289b3

commit_message:
Fail nova-compute init container always

This change makes it so that if any part of the init of
nova-compute fails, the whole init fails.

Also, print out the ip selected for easier debugging.

Partially implements: blueprint init-container-fail

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Icdb0c02072c3323190f8e380e7a2febdb7a463fe

subject: standardize release note page ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
standardize release note page ordering

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ib364dcc8eb31275a31c83b68d7914263b183e393
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/*.py tests (1/2)

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases
that use mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some classes in
cinder/tests/unit/*.py.

Change-Id: I623b3b4bd27efc8e302e6bace011f9d807c2c64f

subject: Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstackclient.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-08 12:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/osc.yaml'], 'message': "Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstackclient.

Testing the sdk & client integration to neutron we need to enable
the qos service and extension.

This patch enables this by importing the on-tree neutron plugin
and enabling the q-qos service.

Neutron plugin is imported because 'q-qos' is only on the Neutron
in-tree plugin; otherwise 'q-qos' won't work.

Change-Id: I8db441111ec4fb0498bee83971caa37a4438d763
Related-bug: 1609472
"}]
commit_message:
Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstackclient.

Testing the sdk & client integration to neutron we need to enable
the qos service and extension.

This patch enables this by importing the on-tree neutron plugin
and enabling the q-qos service.

Neutron plugin is imported because 'q-qos' is only on the Neutron
in-tree plugin; otherwise 'q-qos' won't work.

Change-Id: I8db441111ec4fb0498bee83971caa37a4438d763
Related-bug: 1609472

The dashboard plugin currently does not support the option to update
the registration of an existing languagepack. This patch adds this
option to the dashboard plugin.

commit_message:
Fix the applications deploy functionality in the dashboard

The current dashboard plugin's code for deploying a selected application
is outdated. This patch updates it to work with the current API.

Also, here is a link to a screenshot of what the form for deployment
looks like: http://pasteboard.co/9PWI61bJd.png, and what the details
page looks like after successful deployment of the application:
http://pasteboard.co/9Q2yQELb7.png

Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0abed414ab7e00d39207050981a736be71f54bda
Closes-Bug: #1605073

commit_message:
Add an extension to support old clusters with LCM serializer

This extension allows for usage of LCM engine with older clusters.

User will be able to enable this extension and run a deployment graph
in conjuction with 'enforce_lcm' flag

Related-bug: #1614922

Change-Id: Ia1b54fe3bcd4d8afb89b3e977186b05e93d2c37b

commit_message:
Add an extension to support old clusters with LCM serializer

This extension allows for usage of LCM engine with older clusters.

User will be able to enable this extension and run a deployment graph
in conjuction with 'enforce_lcm' flag

Related-bug: #1614922

Change-Id: Ia1b54fe3bcd4d8afb89b3e977186b05e93d2c37b

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects instead
of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I4c34416623ac6899ab8b780bdd668acb414d09ef

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-31 16:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'ironic_host_manager: fix population of instances info on start

IronicHostManager currently overrides the _init_instance_info()
method of the base class and unconditionally skips population of
instances information for all compute nodes, even if they are not
Ironic ones.

If there are compute nodes with the hypervisor_type different from
Ironic in the same cloud. the instances info will be missing in
nova-scheduler (if IronicHostManager is configured as a host manager
impl in nova.conf), which will effectively break instance affinity
filters like DifferentHostFilter or SameHostFilter, that check set
intersections of instances running on a particular host and the ones
passed as a hint for nova-scheduler in a boot request.

IronicHostManager should use the method implementation of the base
class for non-ironic compute nodes.

Ib1ddb44d71f7b085512c1f3fc0544f7b00c754fe fixed the problem with
scheduling, this change is needed to make sure we also populate the
instances info on start of nova-scheduler.

Closes-Bug: #1606496

Co-Authored-By: Timofei Durakov <tdurakov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9d8d2dc99773df4097c178d924d182a0d1971bcc
'}]
commit_message:
ironic_host_manager: fix population of instances info on start

IronicHostManager currently overrides the _init_instance_info()
method of the base class and unconditionally skips population of
instances information for all compute nodes, even if they are not
Ironic ones.

If there are compute nodes with the hypervisor_type different from
Ironic in the same cloud. the instances info will be missing in
nova-scheduler (if IronicHostManager is configured as a host manager
impl in nova.conf), which will effectively break instance affinity
filters like DifferentHostFilter or SameHostFilter, that check set
intersections of instances running on a particular host and the ones
passed as a hint for nova-scheduler in a boot request.

IronicHostManager should use the method implementation of the base
class for non-ironic compute nodes.

Ib1ddb44d71f7b085512c1f3fc0544f7b00c754fe fixed the problem with
scheduling, this change is needed to make sure we also populate the
instances info on start of nova-scheduler.

Closes-Bug: #1606496

Co-Authored-By: Timofei Durakov <tdurakov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I9d8d2dc99773df4097c178d924d182a0d1971bcc

commit_message:
Pass auth token to diagnostic snapshot dumper

Since Timmy is selfsufficient utility it requires auth token to login to
Fuel to get nodes to dump.
Also getting rid of snapshot configuration unit tests since Timmy
doesn't use most of it.

Change-Id: I559776a701c76bf9f9153550d2989d939d30eb3f
Partial-Bug: #1618965
(cherry picked from commit cf26770465a1eb6cd05d68e7d618dd953a96413f)

commit_message:
Keepalived leaves VIP on the host in case of accidental removal.

This patch removes VIPs when 'kolla-ansible destroy' is invoked.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-02 18:42:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/test_mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/_test_mech_agent.py'], 'message': "macvtap: Mech driver detects invalid migration

As of today, Macvtap agent allows invalid live migrations
from a host with interface mapping 'physnet1:eth1' to a host
with mapping 'physnet1:eth2'. Migration places the macvtap on
the target on 'eth2' instead of 'eth1'. This fix detects
such a migration in the mech driver and lets the portbinding fail.

Nova will put the instance in error state. The instance might
still be able to access the wrong network it migrated to, as
today there is no communication to the agent after a failed binding
after a migration. But at least the user is now aware that
something went wrong.

Change-Id: I92cd6411fe88483b921c92f219afa8e846cc0137
Depends-On: Ib1cc44bf9d01baf4d1f1d26c2a368a5ca7c6ab68
Partial-Bug: #1550400
"}]
commit_message:
macvtap: Mech driver detects invalid migration

As of today, Macvtap agent allows invalid live migrations
from a host with interface mapping 'physnet1:eth1' to a host
with mapping 'physnet1:eth2'. Migration places the macvtap on
the target on 'eth2' instead of 'eth1'. This fix detects
such a migration in the mech driver and lets the portbinding fail.

Nova will put the instance in error state. The instance might
still be able to access the wrong network it migrated to, as
today there is no communication to the agent after a failed binding
after a migration. But at least the user is now aware that
something went wrong.

Change-Id: I92cd6411fe88483b921c92f219afa8e846cc0137
Depends-On: Ib1cc44bf9d01baf4d1f1d26c2a368a5ca7c6ab68
Partial-Bug: #1550400

commit_message:
Move 3 volume methods to v2 volumes_client

These 3 volume methods are used in Cinder V2 API tests only, so
this patch moves these methods into v2 volumes_client before defining
stable interfaces.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9eda6faabb324671d85155660f9d14667ebf0e00

commit_message:
Added set_defaults method to oslo_middleware.cors

This patch adds a set_defaults method to the CORS middleware. It
allows overriding the configuration defaults, both for runtime
execution and for config generation.

Change-Id: Iffc20a09c455fa73239d8fe41491daa309858da9

commit_message:
[docs] Move all example configurations to Appendix

This patch moves the host layout content into two new Appendices
which are intended to provide a holistic view of the configuration
needed to achieve the example configuration.

It also moves all the previously scattered example configuration
content from other sections and collects them into the two
Appendices.

Change-Id: Iec7fda2e6061bdc81b24c8002b5e3477b7998e9d

[ha-guide] add appendix with HA community details

Since the HA guide and HA development in general are both in flux, it is
inevitable that questions will arise when reading the HA guide.
Therefore make it clear what are the community contact points.

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:35:51.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py', 'ironic/tests/functional/api/v1/__init__.py', 'ironic/tests/functional/api/v1/test_root.py'], 'message': 'Split v1 API root unit and functional tests

As described in the two bugs below, Ironic unit and
functional tests are mixed together. If we want to
provide more and better functional tests, we need to
split them first.

This patch is the first one of spliting unit and
functional tests job.

In ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py, routing
test is more like a functional test because it is
based on a real runing pecan server. But check_version
test is just a unit test. So we move routing test
to functional dir.

Change-Id: I88a21eb1ef02b75c13ac1d23c2a424587579b26f
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670
'}]
commit_message:
Split v1 API root unit and functional tests

As described in the two bugs below, Ironic unit and
functional tests are mixed together. If we want to
provide more and better functional tests, we need to
split them first.

This patch is the first one of spliting unit and
functional tests job.

In ironic/tests/unit/api/v1/test_root.py, routing
test is more like a functional test because it is
based on a real runing pecan server. But check_version
test is just a unit test. So we move routing test
to functional dir.

Change-Id: I88a21eb1ef02b75c13ac1d23c2a424587579b26f
Partial-bug: #1607679
Partial-bug: #1491670

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/api/contrib/ tests (2/2)

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases
that use mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some classes in
cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/*.py.

Change-Id: I3039a7ba4f83fd2fcf02fd64733693fb6b2693e3

subject: Disable usage of dynamic credentials by default in functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-11 15:59:51.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'magnum/tests/functional/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Disable usage of dynamic credentials by default in functional tests

Adds pre-provisioned credentials in accounts.yaml to be used as
default for tests where project sharing is required among users.
For other tests, passing force_tenant_isolation=True enables usage
of dynamic credentials generated by Tempest.

Change-Id: I83482cdaee96632101996c1ba2ce8eeae69d35a7
Closes-Bug: #1610186
'}]
commit_message:
Disable usage of dynamic credentials by default in functional tests

Adds pre-provisioned credentials in accounts.yaml to be used as
default for tests where project sharing is required among users.
For other tests, passing force_tenant_isolation=True enables usage
of dynamic credentials generated by Tempest.

Change-Id: I83482cdaee96632101996c1ba2ce8eeae69d35a7
Closes-Bug: #1610186

subject: Fixed inconsistent positional arguments naming
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fixed inconsistent positional arguments naming

When printing the help menu for Swift commands, it is confusing to see
both positional arguments and options not distinguished. The
positional arguments are supposed to be enclosed in angular braces <>,
options in square braces [] and optional positional arguments in [<>].

Change-Id: Ie84a90eb0278dd2cdf5775948572bb140f8d2c4b
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed inconsistent positional arguments naming

When printing the help menu for Swift commands, it is confusing to see
both positional arguments and options not distinguished. The
positional arguments are supposed to be enclosed in angular braces <>,
options in square braces [] and optional positional arguments in [<>].

Change-Id: Ie84a90eb0278dd2cdf5775948572bb140f8d2c4b

commit_message:
Now fuel plugins adapter not skipping empty fields.

Additional cleanup changes:
* ReportNode and FilesManager are cleaned and covered by tests
* Adapters dividet to the multiple files
* Plugin create method is cleaned and mandatory fields are made explicit

Change-Id: If1b893edb7aced05e1b05988c87b9f87533d6344
Closes-Bug: #1616722

commit_message:
Add explicit dependencies to pass puppet4

  This commit will add explicit dependencies in some resources in the
  provision profile.

  Without this change the CI does not pass on Puppet 4 because of the
  change in default run order.

Depends-On: Ifc3f40ae1cb71c215b8a0bf6cd5f6d05101a6168

Change-Id: Iedfa6f78936676ba54ebb888734a3b381a2378e7

commit_message:
Enable QoS on neutron for python-openstackclient functional tests

The openstackclient projects will be adding qos support for it's neutron
commands, functional tests will be added. This patch enables the neutron
qos service for the functional tests.

Change-Id: Ife549ff6499217ca65e2554be8ef86ea7866b2d8
Related-bug: 1609472

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-31 13:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py'], 'message': 'ironic_host_manager: fix population of instances info on schedule

IronicHostManager currently overrides the _get_instance_info() method
of the base class and unconditionally returns an empty dict of
instances for a given compute node.

The problem with that is that in a heterogeneous cloud with both
libvirt and ironic compute nodes this will always return {} for the
former too, which is incorrect and will effectively break instance
affinity filters like DifferentHostFilter or SameHostFilter, that
check set intersections of instances running on a particular host and
the ones passed as a hint for nova-scheduler in a boot request.

IronicHostManager should use the method implementation of the base
class for non-ironic compute nodes.

This is a partial fix which only modifies _get_instance_info() called
down the select_destinations() stack. A following change will modify
_init_instance_info() that pre-populates node instances info on start
of a nova-scheduler process.

Partial-Bug: #1606496

Change-Id: Ib1ddb44d71f7b085512c1f3fc0544f7b00c754fe
'}]
commit_message:
ironic_host_manager: fix population of instances info on schedule

IronicHostManager currently overrides the _get_instance_info() method
of the base class and unconditionally returns an empty dict of
instances for a given compute node.

The problem with that is that in a heterogeneous cloud with both
libvirt and ironic compute nodes this will always return {} for the
former too, which is incorrect and will effectively break instance
affinity filters like DifferentHostFilter or SameHostFilter, that
check set intersections of instances running on a particular host and
the ones passed as a hint for nova-scheduler in a boot request.

IronicHostManager should use the method implementation of the base
class for non-ironic compute nodes.

This is a partial fix which only modifies _get_instance_info() called
down the select_destinations() stack. A following change will modify
_init_instance_info() that pre-populates node instances info on start
of a nova-scheduler process.

Partial-Bug: #1606496

Change-Id: Ib1ddb44d71f7b085512c1f3fc0544f7b00c754fe

commit_message:
Enable parallel job execution for the scheduler to allow abort signals

Now the scheduler uses two pools of resources to handle execution of jobs.
The first one will handle the polling of jobs from the api.
The second one will handle the job exection. This way we avoid blocking the
scheduler while running jobs.

Abort a running job is now enabled thanks to the parallel execution.

Depends-on: I9e92ccdd7c592a8109fe8398db6d53c9c42dc10a
Closes-bug: 1615662
Change-Id: I48153dcb521b6a8f0138d5ef81239cf4cded4df0

subject: DevStack: make /var/log/calico writable by DHCP agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 17:11:03.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "DevStack: make /var/log/calico writable by DHCP agent

In a DevStack install, the Calico DHCP agent runs as an unprivileged
user, instead of as root.  This is appropriate because it uses a lot of
Neutron library code, which includes two specific things:

1. It uses Neutron's file-based locking mechanism, which requires
   accessing the lock directory with similar credentials as other
   Neutron components.

2. It uses rootwrap when it needs to do privileged operations, and so
   does not need as a whole to run as root.

(Correspondingly, patches are currently up to modify the package-based
installs of networking-calico to run the DHCP agent as 'neutron' instead
of as root.)

The log directory /var/log/calico is created by calico-felix, which runs
as root, and so needs to be chmod'd to allow calico-dhcp-agent to write
to it too.

Change-Id: If85e27ad12df8ec35d3723ce316889a13124e659
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: make /var/log/calico writable by DHCP agent

In a DevStack install, the Calico DHCP agent runs as an unprivileged
user, instead of as root.  This is appropriate because it uses a lot of
Neutron library code, which includes two specific things:

1. It uses Neutron's file-based locking mechanism, which requires
   accessing the lock directory with similar credentials as other
   Neutron components.

2. It uses rootwrap when it needs to do privileged operations, and so
   does not need as a whole to run as root.

(Correspondingly, patches are currently up to modify the package-based
installs of networking-calico to run the DHCP agent as 'neutron' instead
of as root.)

The log directory /var/log/calico is created by calico-felix, which runs
as root, and so needs to be chmod'd to allow calico-dhcp-agent to write
to it too.

Change-Id: If85e27ad12df8ec35d3723ce316889a13124e659

commit_message:
Puppet 4 support backport.

Cherry-picking of changes to master branch
List: https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1586480 status:merged branch:master

A lot of files are changed in multiple patches.
Instead of creating a fragile chain of patches, the patches are rolled up
into one big change.
Cherry-picking the changes one by one would add several commits with
incorrect code.

Involved changes:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324384

subject: Add infos about fields in hashmap documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-05 14:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/rating/hashmap.rst'], 'message': 'Add infos about fields in hashmap documentation

Added network.bw.in, network.bw.out and network.floating to service list
in hashmap.rst. This list is now a bullet list.

Added list of available fields for the compute, image and volume services
when using ceilometer.

Changed a typo

Change-Id: I6b8894506bb03cf86c5e7c5423214c6f4eff473e

This change adds a dependency graph section and image into the developer
docs. It is meant to be generated on each docs run.

All galaxy roles are placed into the playbooks/roles directory for
ansigenome to find, since it does not reference /etc/ansible/roles, nor

'}]
commit_message:
Generate a role dependency graph with docs.

This change adds a dependency graph section and image into the developer
docs. It is meant to be generated on each docs run.

The bootstrap-ansible.sh script assumes a Linux OS so, the
documentation python requirements were split into a separate pip
requirements file, allowing tox to install ansible for the sole
purpose of checking out galaxy roles.

All galaxy roles are placed into the playbooks/roles directory for
ansigenome to find, since it does not reference /etc/ansible/roles, nor
does it take multiple paths for input. As of this commit, there is a
combination of roles installed from Galaxy and roles maintained in-tree,
so this must be done to get all of them included.

On the rendered role dependencies page, the image is scaled down so as
to fit, but will likely require a click through to be fully readable.

Ansigenome is added as a dependency for docs in this patch, and is
licensed as GPLv3. Since this is being called as a binary, rather than
linked as code, this should be alright in terms of licensing.

Change-Id: Ifec91a72044a4a361fafbd40d0f25a2d278636b1

commit_message:
Port pagination on Python 3

Use an empty string rather None as marker for bisect.
On Python 3, a comparison between None and strings now raises a TypeError.

Partially implements: blueprint trove-python3

Change-Id: Iaefc20bd1cc980732e0c8a075e570958335c17e1

Itroduced deployment sequences

commit_message:
Add a doc example for yaml file overrides

Adds an example for yaml config file overrides and provides
clarification that the entire yaml file contents are overwritten
by any supplied override values, not just the added or changed values.

commit_message:
Move 'ceph_ready_check' task from shell to puppet

This change moves the 'ceph_ready_check' task from the shell to the
puppet to eliminate the extra point of the failure: the puppet shell
wrapper script for the task temporary created and uploaded to the
node by the astute. TODO: rewrite the ruby script to the custom
puppet function instead of use the exec.

Closes-Bug: 1619727
Change-Id: I725e6f2cbba3ab6252a4212b89f939fe05de5e14
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Turn off bindep

bindep installs a slew of stuff we don't really need and doesn't add
much if any value.  This only turns on bindeps that are required.

This shaves about 3 minutes off each gate run.

Closes-Bug: #1620865
Change-Id: I24df4f2a30c682c1b09e89c7c52f7608582da1a6
(cherry picked from commit b51d1078477b9972bdf312d40480fc18eded8568)

commit_message:
Optimize finder functions for task executions

* Removed unused heavy functions
* Changing implementation of finder functions so that they don't
  initialize the entire task_executions collection of workflow
  execution object
* Fixed the unit test for reverse workflow controller to rely on
  real persistent objects (workflow and task executions) instead
  of mocks

Change-Id: If6d92ee36da91bd5780ec1a7a3bf2059bb228bf6

commit_message:
Move 'ceph_ready_check' task from shell to puppet

This change moves the 'ceph_ready_check' task from the shell to the
puppet to eliminate the extra point of the failure: the puppet shell
wrapper script for the task temporary created and uploaded to the
node by the astute. TODO: rewrite the ruby script to the custom
puppet function instead of use the exec.

Closes-Bug: 1619727
Change-Id: I725e6f2cbba3ab6252a4212b89f939fe05de5e14
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Distinct OVS agent namespaces in fullstack tests

The ovs agents should be run in separate namespace to have better
isolation from resources of concurrent ovs agent processes. However,
when starting ovs agents, sudo is used that wipes out virtualenv
settings (set up originally by tox). Hence virtualenv needs to be
restored before Python starts searching for imported modules.

Further, due to namespace changes, the devices used by ovs agent
need to be connected with the proper namespace via veth devices,
and OVS DB is set to listen on all interfaces instead of just
127.0.0.1 so that it allows connection from these namespaces
via veth devices.

Change-Id: I4b5411ca92eed64061d000f0a90ac7f9e57e41d6
Closes-Bug: 1613680

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-07 15:08:04.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/common/test_driver_factory.py', 'ironic/common/driver_factory.py', 'ironic/drivers/base.py'], 'message': "Log a warning for unsupported drivers and interfaces

This iterates over all loaded drivers/interfaces at factory
initialization time, and looks at an attribute 'supported'. If supported
is not True, a message will be logged that the driver is unsupported,
deprecated, and may be removed in a future release.

This patch marks all drivers as supported, and subsequent patches will
mark specific drivers as unsupported, based on their testing status.

This also changes the NetworkInterface class to inherit from
BaseInterface (to make this work right). That looks like a programming
error when that interface was created.

Change-Id: I6f9fa4f367bd2e14e5992d2e601bfdcf852ef3a4
Partial-Bug: #1526410
"}]
commit_message:
Log a warning for unsupported drivers and interfaces

This iterates over all loaded drivers/interfaces at factory
initialization time, and looks at an attribute 'supported'. If supported
is not True, a message will be logged that the driver is unsupported,
deprecated, and may be removed in a future release.

This patch marks all drivers as supported, and subsequent patches will
mark specific drivers as unsupported, based on their testing status.

This also changes the NetworkInterface class to inherit from
BaseInterface (to make this work right). That looks like a programming
error when that interface was created.

Change-Id: I6f9fa4f367bd2e14e5992d2e601bfdcf852ef3a4
Partial-Bug: #1526410

subject: Fix the ansible-lint gate job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 15:39:56.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/tripleo-roles.yml', 'playbooks/dlrn-gate.yml', 'roles/environment/teardown/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/quickstart.yml', 'ci-scripts/ansible-lint.sh', 'playbooks/provision.yml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Fix the ansible-lint gate job

Previously the linters gate job returned successfully in all cases and
it only checked the playbooks and none of the roles.

This adds a more comprehensive ansible-lint check to the playbook and
makes it fail in case any of the lint processes exits with non-zero.

It also defaults the linter tox task to python2 as ansible-lint does not
support python3 and fixes the envlist in tox.ini to allow people to simply
run 'tox' without arguments.

Change-Id: Ieb28fa06a5d15665132007559f33ea8b80d83ca4

Fix the ansible-lint errors in playbooks and roles

Change-Id: I2de54f5f8329a36b4c29f62819c3dca49b6f54ed
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the ansible-lint gate job

Previously the linters gate job returned successfully in all cases and
it only checked the playbooks and none of the roles.

This adds a more comprehensive ansible-lint check to the playbook and
makes it fail in case any of the lint processes exits with non-zero.

It also defaults the linter tox task to python2 as ansible-lint does not
support python3 and fixes the envlist in tox.ini to allow people to simply
run 'tox' without arguments.

Change-Id: Ieb28fa06a5d15665132007559f33ea8b80d83ca4

Fix the ansible-lint errors in playbooks and roles

Change-Id: I2de54f5f8329a36b4c29f62819c3dca49b6f54ed

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-01 06:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py'], 'message': 'BugFix: L3 scheduler scheduling distributed routers

The L3 gateway router scheduler auto-schedules those routers
which have not been assigned a chassis (yet), when a new
chassis appears in the OVN_Southbound DB. This auto-scheduling
should only be done for those routers which are gateway routers.

Gateway Routers were either assigned a valid chassis during
creation or their options field was marked with
"chassis:neutron-ovn-invalid-chassis"

TODO: A unit test does need to be added for this case. It
will be part of series of ovsdb unit test case for the L3
scheduler logic (since the logic is based on the data in
the ovsdb).

Change-Id: I6e723e5394b564227db3f3834e29343197f4d86a
Closes-Bug: 1618508
'}]
commit_message:
BugFix: L3 scheduler scheduling distributed routers

The L3 gateway router scheduler auto-schedules those routers
which have not been assigned a chassis (yet), when a new
chassis appears in the OVN_Southbound DB. This auto-scheduling
should only be done for those routers which are gateway routers.

Gateway Routers were either assigned a valid chassis during
creation or their options field was marked with
"chassis:neutron-ovn-invalid-chassis"

TODO: A unit test does need to be added for this case. It
will be part of series of ovsdb unit test case for the L3
scheduler logic (since the logic is based on the data in
the ovsdb).

Change-Id: I6e723e5394b564227db3f3834e29343197f4d86a
Closes-Bug: 1618508

commit_message:
Enable hugepages for idempotency tests

At some point allocate_hugepages task started
to execute on a condition (that hugepages are set
for a node in question).
To cover checking allocate_hugepages task for
idempotency the tests have been updated to enable
this setting.

Also update idempotency task fixtures due to some new
tasks appeared in deployment flow of the corresponding
cluster configs.

Change-Id: Ic1354ab128362e40a4c46fc79830d43d2725d0ee
Closes-Bug: #1614919

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/volume/drivers/emc/*.py tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases that use
mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in
cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/*.py.

Change-Id: Ic45496bbe84a93953b6eb6c413ef276084f859f2

subject: Replace some 'nested' mapping types with 'object'
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-08 01:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin_utils.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_nova_server_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bugs-1619047-nested-mappings-4ddb2d0b067b3093.yaml', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/metadefs.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/designate/recordsets.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/flavors.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/hypervisors.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/servers.py'], 'message': 'Replace some 'nested' mapping types with 'object'

A number of fields (on nova servers, hypervisors, flavors, metadefs,
recordsets) were marked with 'type': 'nested'. 'nested' is only required
where there will be arrays of complex objects which was not the case in
many of these instances. Nested fields are harder to run queries again,
and more difficult to aggregate. This patch re-types those fields to
'object' but leaves inner mappings untouched.

'object' type fields can now be listed as facets and queried
with e.g. "image.id:abc123".

Some additional changes were required in the facet term aggregation code
because previously any inner fields were considered part of a nested
mapping.

This patch requires reindexing of all data in affected types.

Change-Id: I35cb9b43d4281c2cabdb602bf64af096ca4b9955
Closes-Bug: #1619047
'}]
commit_message:
Replace some 'nested' mapping types with 'object'

A number of fields (on nova servers, hypervisors, flavors, metadefs,
recordsets) were marked with 'type': 'nested'. 'nested' is only required
where there will be arrays of complex objects which was not the case in
many of these instances. Nested fields are harder to run queries again,
and more difficult to aggregate. This patch re-types those fields to
'object' but leaves inner mappings untouched.

'object' type fields can now be listed as facets and queried
with e.g. "image.id:abc123".

Some additional changes were required in the facet term aggregation code
because previously any inner fields were considered part of a nested
mapping.

This patch requires reindexing of all data in affected types.

Change-Id: I35cb9b43d4281c2cabdb602bf64af096ca4b9955
Closes-Bug: #1619047

commit_message:
Create entries for overcloud VIPs in /etc/hosts

This will aid us in using FQDNs instead of IPs if DNS is not set. If
the deployer already has DNS set up, they can easily disable this
profile by adding the use-dns-for-vips.yaml environment file.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I8c1b3f253d0149d575171c208f9a1342a7b26450
Depends-On: I1bdb2701dfb3e7ef072e674c9882d3be5af7296c

commit_message:
Add class to write overcloud VIPs into /etc/hosts

This will be useful to start using FQDNs instead of IPs if we don't
have a DNS set-up. This will effectively grab a map of hosts to add
and create them with puppet's host resource.

Change-Id: I1bdb2701dfb3e7ef072e674c9882d3be5af7296c

So, if a horizon plugin uses fa-star-o,
the material theme just shows an empty box.

Closes-Bug: #1621341

commit_message:
Allow for building specific images

It was not possible to build a single image if the yaml files passed
had multiple images defined. This adds a --image-name parameter to
tripleo-build-images to allow for that.

Change-Id: I5644656bbdc534f54c254edc7e939ae36f1f98ca
Closes-Bug: #1618566

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I5b4bdcb674b58ab419d00ca9c6bff105ce19aca8

commit_message:
[placement] Add additional allocation tests

There was some concern that the placement service was not properly
attending to inventory constraints while trying to save allocations.
This change adds more test to cover some situations.

Related-Bug: #1620736

Change-Id: Icbb2d88eeae9a06d60f2071b660d4b7b6c1aa80d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-22 01:20:57.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py', 'magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'magnum/db/api.py', 'magnum/objects/baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'magnum/common/exception.py'], 'message': "Override name of shared baymodel

Add a configuration directive 'allow_baymodel_name_override',
default value is TRUE. If TRUE, override name of shared BayModel
resources will be allowed, as they are today. If FALSE, the name
of new created baymodel need to be different with the shared
BayModel resources in other projects (note: if the new created
BayModel is in the same project with the shared one, then the
name of new created BayModel can be same with the shared one
whether 'allow_baymodel_name_override' is set to TRUE or not).

This way, by default Magnum allow override name of shared BayModel
and cloud operators can decide if they want to allow override or not.

In the case of clouds that want to allow sharing access to a BayModel
between multiple projects (example: a shared BayModel named 'k8s')
with 'allow_baymodel_name_override' set to TRUE, a user will still
be allowed to create a BayModel with the name 'k8s' and it will
override the shared one.

Change-Id: Ia38e8816775469c0db666855f7fa23800def9e3c
Implements: blueprint duplicate-named-bay-and-baymodel
"}]
commit_message:
Override name of shared baymodel

Add a configuration directive 'allow_baymodel_name_override',
default value is TRUE. If TRUE, override name of shared BayModel
resources will be allowed, as they are today. If FALSE, the name
of new created baymodel need to be different with the shared
BayModel resources in other projects (note: if the new created
BayModel is in the same project with the shared one, then the
name of new created BayModel can be same with the shared one
whether 'allow_baymodel_name_override' is set to TRUE or not).

This way, by default Magnum allow override name of shared BayModel
and cloud operators can decide if they want to allow override or not.

In the case of clouds that want to allow sharing access to a BayModel
between multiple projects (example: a shared BayModel named 'k8s')
with 'allow_baymodel_name_override' set to TRUE, a user will still
be allowed to create a BayModel with the name 'k8s' and it will
override the shared one.

Change-Id: Ia38e8816775469c0db666855f7fa23800def9e3c
Implements: blueprint duplicate-named-bay-and-baymodel

  whitelists.

Change-Id: I89b2a487740fbe21de730527351bd33595403d42
Related-Bug: 1586480

commit_message:
Reduce the number of debug traces emitted by registry callbacks

The tool has become popular beyond my wildest expectations. A typical
run in the gate at debug level yields more than 20K traces in the
neutron-server alone. However, reducing the number of traces is
beneficial across the board and that's the first attempt at bringing
the size of Neutron logs closer to other services'.

Partial-bug: #1620864

Change-Id: I2576e59961ec8928ad71d778253b2d37d470d909

commit_message:
Restart apache only if changes were made to the keystone-main or admin conf

* apache service should only be restarted if the config was actually changed
* fixed a minor bug in the registration spec

Change-Id: Id36bfa5e689cd7b93f7ce18f6381e9b8dbdcc64c
Closes-Bug: #1614312

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-31 04:13:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/metadata/modal/modal.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/metadata/modal/modal.controller.spec.js'], 'message': "Add message for a result of update metadata

At the moment, even when a user update a metadata, this result is
not informed to a user (any message is not displayed).
So a user cannot know its result and he has to redisplay
'Update Metadata' modal in order to know its result.

Change-Id: I02b1a3c70d0225d2326d038b7519d49b0082985e
Closes-Bug: #1608361
"}]
commit_message:
Add message for a result of update metadata

At the moment, even when a user update a metadata, this result is
not informed to a user (any message is not displayed).
So a user cannot know its result and he has to redisplay
'Update Metadata' modal in order to know its result.

Change-Id: I02b1a3c70d0225d2326d038b7519d49b0082985e
Closes-Bug: #1608361

commit_message:
Add material mapping for filter icon

The material theme is missing an icon for filter.
So, if a horizon plugin uses fa-filter,
the material theme just shows an empty box.

Change-Id: I7a7c6b337cf2a2906df9cb54c12e513d7a2c2c5e
Closes-Bug: #1621310

commit_message:
Modify the link to make more direct and clear

There should provide link for 'command-line interface for networking',
but the article provide the link for 'OpenStack End User Guide', so it
is not direct and accurate, so this patch provide the direct link and
delete the useless link.

Change-Id: Ic023b4feb3de076d4e17e80e57dfa01b1362864c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 00:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "tripleo: enable voting for scenarios

Scenarios are now passing CI, we would like to enable voting so we can
start to gate on services we didn't gate before. It will improve the
quality of TripleO services and we won't break their deployment anymore.

See https://review.openstack.org/366427 results to see them passing
tests.

Change-Id: I36e36357253b1892e6feacb542e3714a34937969

commit_message:
tripleo: enable voting for scenarios

Scenarios are now passing CI, we would like to enable voting so we can
start to gate on services we didn't gate before. It will improve the
quality of TripleO services and we won't break their deployment anymore.

See https://review.openstack.org/366427 results to see them passing
tests.

Change-Id: I36e36357253b1892e6feacb542e3714a34937969

commit_message:
Add jenkins-plugins-for-murano project to Openstack

The goal of the project is to develop and maintain a set of Jenkins
plugins that allows Jenkins to deploy Murano environments using
Jenkins.

This project is not a part of the Murano project because plugins
works inside Jenkins.

subject: fix logic for adding new release notes pages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 20:46:43.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/add_release_note_page.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/make_stable_branch.sh'], 'message': "fix logic for adding new release notes pages

Start by moving the steps to their own script so they are easier to test
locally. Then fix the logic for inserting new entries into the toctree
so it takes the indentation into account. This version assumes we're
standardizing on listing release notes in reverse chronological order,
and those changes will be made separately.

Change-Id: Ib1f74e05c36ba1d247c324c276cfc2d8d75d9420
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix logic for adding new release notes pages

Start by moving the steps to their own script so they are easier to test
locally. Then fix the logic for inserting new entries into the toctree
so it takes the indentation into account. This version assumes we're
standardizing on listing release notes in reverse chronological order,
and those changes will be made separately.

Change-Id: Ib1f74e05c36ba1d247c324c276cfc2d8d75d9420
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Create fuel-nailgun-extension-iac project

Add Dragonflow fullstack test for ML2 module

Dragonflow can be used in two modes: core-plugin and ml2 mechanism

continuous integration testing done on that configuration.

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 06:39:26.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_eni.py', 'os_net_config/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#0>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I55ce4f09297f7be2472a6664435c2c9d9f86595c
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#0>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I55ce4f09297f7be2472a6664435c2c9d9f86595c

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/consistencygroup/*.py tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases that use
mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in
cinder/tests/unit/consistencygroup/test_cg.py.

Change-Id: I5ac9f42a059f4d8d86eb1498e5003e359943f3be

subject: Move element-info to a standard entry-point
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-08 05:30:20.000000000', 'files': ['bin/element-info', 'releasenotes/notes/element-info-entry-point-448bf622be6061a0.yaml', 'lib/common-functions', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py', 'setup.cfg', 'MANIFEST.in', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': "Move element-info to a standard entry-point

Move element-info from a wrapper script to a standard entry-point
console_script.

Update the documentation to explain how to run it for development.  I
don't think we should support the idea that you can check-out the code
and run ./bin/disk-image-create -- it has dependencies (dib-utils,
etc) and needs to be run from a virtualenv (this is what CI in the
gate does).  A follow-up can clean-up some of the path munging stuff
we have for this in disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Ic0c03995667f320a27ac30441279f3e6abb6bca8
"}]
commit_message:
Move element-info to a standard entry-point

Move element-info from a wrapper script to a standard entry-point
console_script.

Update the documentation to explain how to run it for development.  I
don't think we should support the idea that you can check-out the code
and run ./bin/disk-image-create -- it has dependencies (dib-utils,
etc) and needs to be run from a virtualenv (this is what CI in the
gate does).  A follow-up can clean-up some of the path munging stuff
we have for this in disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Ic0c03995667f320a27ac30441279f3e6abb6bca8

subject: Update reno for stable/newton
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:19:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/newton.rst', 'releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'Update reno for stable/newton

In addition to adding the new newton page, this fixes the existing
release notes build to show notes for unreleased versions, which ensures
that no poorly formatted release note breaks the release notes build.

It also fixes the toctree directive at the top of the release notes.

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: I14bd797d49ff00cfca1d3113e5b0b87d66d42d70
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update reno for stable/newton

In addition to adding the new newton page, this fixes the existing
release notes build to show notes for unreleased versions, which ensures
that no poorly formatted release note breaks the release notes build.

It also fixes the toctree directive at the top of the release notes.

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: I14bd797d49ff00cfca1d3113e5b0b87d66d42d70
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-07 12:23:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/quota/resource_registry.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/quota/test_resource_registry.py', 'neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': 'Except if tracked resource registered as countable

If a resource was registered in the quota engine before
being set as a tracked resource, it would have been registered
as a CountableResource instead of a TrackedResource.

This would cause a failure later when the resources were
being unregistered because the quota engine thought it
should have been a TrackedResource and tried to call
unregister_events on it.

This patch just prevents resources from being registered
as both types. It also callse unregister_all_resources as
part of the standard test case cleanup since the vast majority
of tests are using a plugin that may register resources.

Closes-Bug: #1612222
Change-Id: I8a40f38d7c0e5aeca257ba62115fa9b02ad5aa93
'}]
commit_message:
Except if tracked resource registered as countable

If a resource was registered in the quota engine before
being set as a tracked resource, it would have been registered
as a CountableResource instead of a TrackedResource.

This would cause a failure later when the resources were
being unregistered because the quota engine thought it
should have been a TrackedResource and tried to call
unregister_events on it.

This patch just prevents resources from being registered
as both types. It also callse unregister_all_resources as
part of the standard test case cleanup since the vast majority
of tests are using a plugin that may register resources.

Closes-Bug: #1612222
Change-Id: I8a40f38d7c0e5aeca257ba62115fa9b02ad5aa93

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 06:44:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_eni.py', 'os_net_config/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#0>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I49d09ba21ff86aaaa1080c38687aa0e46cdf12a6
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#0>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable
>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I49d09ba21ff86aaaa1080c38687aa0e46cdf12a6

commit_message:
Display correct number of total results

Due to a dependency on smart table in horizon,
the number of results displayed is not accurate.

This patch now shows the total number of hits and
the total number that are displayed (limited by the search limit).

Pagination is still handled through smart table. This will
be fixed in a future patch.

Change-Id: Ia00de35a76e4259f77e32581871bf3614e381dcc
Closes-Bug: 1616754

Change-Id: Ic89f3c71d64aed32cc839351d67ac13f128787c5

commit_message:
add newton  release and standardize release note page order

In order to support automatically updating the release notes
when we create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a
standard order. This patch add newton release and  updates the
order to be reverse chronological, so the most recent notes
appear at the top.

Change-Id: Ic89f3c71d64aed32cc839351d67ac13f128787c5

commit_message:
Fix deployment_tasks api, when graph_type is an empty string

Nailgun should treat and empty string, given to

/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/?graph_type=$
/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/plugins/?graph_type=$
/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/release/?graph_type=$
e.t.c.

as default graph type. So let's convert some 'false'
values to None in handlers.

Change-Id: I238764d24fc14b2a41baaca37dabb6264e7e91d8
Closes-Bug: #1576261
(cherry picked from commit e31b5b16ee3529cd835a05ec523c0c0731c0c671)

commit_message:
Remove user_id policy enforcement from unlock_override

Currently server unlock_override honor the user_id policy
rule enforcement which is not right as this is not destructive
action on resource.

This patch removes it from unlock_override.

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: Ibec1ecfe3a452694f238e10c5da42a5c9179f5b9

commit_message:
Remove user_id policy enforcement from server start

Currently server start honor the user_id policy rule enforcement
which is not right as this is not destructive action on resource.

This patch removes it from server start action and corresponding tests
too.

Note- deleting test_start_policy_failed from test_serversV21.py as this
is duplicate of what we have in test_server_start_stop.py

Partially implements blueprint user_id_based_policy_enforcement

Change-Id: I961730873a8d78d33e8ebe2c020b88a090396dc5

commit_message:
Config: change deprecation for max_fixed_ips_per_port to Ocata

Update the configuration help to indicate that this will be
deprecated in Ocata. Patches to provide an alternative solution
have been deferred to Ocata. So gthis will update the help
to ensure that it comes with an alternative solution.

The release note does not need to be updated as it indicates that
the variable will be deprecated in Newton or Ocata.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9adb3391574016811b664d024856f2c5010130f0

subject: Convert OVO fields to primitives for to_dict()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8726, 'name': 'Victor Morales', 'email': 'chipahuac@hotmail.com', 'username': 'electrocucaracha'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18289, 'name': 'Sreekumar S', 'email': 'sreesiv@gmail.com', 'username': 'sreesiv'}, {'_account_id': 21784, 'name': 'Radek Zetik', 'email': 'radekx.zetik@intel.com', 'username': 'rzetikx'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-07 10:50:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/base.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/qos/test_policy.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_base.py'], 'message': "Convert OVO fields to primitives for to_dict()

to_dict() is used for conversions of OVO objects into
regular dictionaries to be used as plugin return values
to the API layer, etc. It provides the equivalent of
make_<resource>_dict that we use now (without the extension
processing). The values in these dictionaries should be
ready for representation in the API.

The issue was that the OVO to_dict() implementation was
placing complex types right into the dictionary which
would mean that the API would serialize them just by
calling str() on them (as part of json encoding). This
ignored the 'to_primitive' method defined on the OVO
type that defines how a field should be converted.
Therefore, when it came to timestamps to_dict() was
placing native datetime objects into the dictionary
which would convert to microsecond resolution, violating
the expected format of the OVO DateTime type.

This patch fixes the issue by calling 'to_primitive'
on each non-synthetic field in the to_dict() method
to ensure we match the expected format of the type before
we send it out the API.

Closes-Bug: #1620254
Change-Id: Ic0be54b1d4b23119e1458d4532e2f70bff0ff9f6
"}]
commit_message:
Convert OVO fields to primitives for to_dict()

to_dict() is used for conversions of OVO objects into
regular dictionaries to be used as plugin return values
to the API layer, etc. It provides the equivalent of
make_<resource>_dict that we use now (without the extension
processing). The values in these dictionaries should be
ready for representation in the API.

The issue was that the OVO to_dict() implementation was
placing complex types right into the dictionary which
would mean that the API would serialize them just by
calling str() on them (as part of json encoding). This
ignored the 'to_primitive' method defined on the OVO
type that defines how a field should be converted.
Therefore, when it came to timestamps to_dict() was
placing native datetime objects into the dictionary
which would convert to microsecond resolution, violating
the expected format of the OVO DateTime type.

This patch fixes the issue by calling 'to_primitive'
on each non-synthetic field in the to_dict() method
to ensure we match the expected format of the type before
we send it out the API.

Closes-Bug: #1620254
Change-Id: Ic0be54b1d4b23119e1458d4532e2f70bff0ff9f6

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/scheduler/*.py tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases that use
mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in
cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler.py.

Change-Id: Id2d2fc485ff7420c1e263f6b8b970ddee3d82cf5

subject: Move element-info a standard entry-point
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-09-08 04:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['bin/element-info', 'releasenotes/notes/element-info-entry-point-448bf622be6061a0.yaml', 'lib/common-functions', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py', 'setup.cfg', 'MANIFEST.in', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': "Move element-info a standard entry-point

Move element-info from a wrapper script to a standard entry-point
console_script.

Update the documentation to explain how to run it for development.  I
don't think we should support the idea that you can check-out the code
and run ./bin/disk-image-create -- it has dependencies (dib-utils,
etc) and needs to be run from a virtualenv (this is what CI in the
gate does).  A follow-up can clean-up some of the path munging stuff
we have for this in disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Ic0c03995667f320a27ac30441279f3e6abb6bca8
"}]
commit_message:
Move element-info a standard entry-point

Move element-info from a wrapper script to a standard entry-point
console_script.

Update the documentation to explain how to run it for development.  I
don't think we should support the idea that you can check-out the code
and run ./bin/disk-image-create -- it has dependencies (dib-utils,
etc) and needs to be run from a virtualenv (this is what CI in the
gate does).  A follow-up can clean-up some of the path munging stuff
we have for this in disk-image-create.

Change-Id: Ic0c03995667f320a27ac30441279f3e6abb6bca8

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/zonemanager/*.py tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases that use
mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in
cinder/tests/unit/zonemanager/test_fc_zone_manager.py.

subject: Ref count for dict item should be Py_DECREF
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-09-08 04:41:00.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_pyeclib_api.py', 'src/c/pyeclib_c/pyeclib_c.c'], 'message': "Ref count for dict item should be Py_DECREF

PyDict_SetItems doesn't steal the reference count so that the reference
count of each item in the dict should be decremented via Py_DECREF
*before* returning the dict to Python VM. Otherwise, those items can be
leaked which can never be collected as garbage.

The evicence for memory leak is avaialble for using debug mode python VM like:
https://gist.github.com/bloodeagle40234/f4c0cd267e085cc6224ffdc1b1822631

Plus, this patch add one unit test to check the memory increasement for
many call of get_segment_info.

Closes-Bug: #1604335

Change-Id: I6780efb9718017d296606f3c7e60684910584a1a
"}]
commit_message:
Ref count for dict item should be Py_DECREF

PyDict_SetItems doesn't steal the reference count so that the reference
count of each item in the dict should be decremented via Py_DECREF
*before* returning the dict to Python VM. Otherwise, those items can be
leaked which can never be collected as garbage.

The evicence for memory leak is avaialble for using debug mode python VM like:
https://gist.github.com/bloodeagle40234/f4c0cd267e085cc6224ffdc1b1822631

Plus, this patch add one unit test to check the memory increasement for
many call of get_segment_info.

Closes-Bug: #1604335

Change-Id: I6780efb9718017d296606f3c7e60684910584a1a

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-07 05:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['src/c/pyeclib_c/pyeclib_c.c'], 'message': "Correct fragment size handling

Once we have liberasurecode older than depend-on patch, it could make
an invalid mem access if the backend descripter is not available.
(I'm not sure this situation happen in fact, but any other functions in
liberasurecode expecting that failure actually, FWIW)

To recover this failure, this patch fixes to catch the return value from
liberasurecode and if it's an error code, set an error for the return
value to python.

Depends-On: I489f8b5d049610863b5e0b477b6ff70ead245b55
Change-Id: I47d4ec4fa1647c5a4c8d50f0aa6a2df86ca68c80
"}]
commit_message:
Correct fragment size handling

Once we have liberasurecode older than depend-on patch, it could make
an invalid mem access if the backend descripter is not available.
(I'm not sure this situation happen in fact, but any other functions in
liberasurecode expecting that failure actually, FWIW)

To recover this failure, this patch fixes to catch the return value from
liberasurecode and if it's an error code, set an error for the return
value to python.

Depends-On: I489f8b5d049610863b5e0b477b6ff70ead245b55
Change-Id: I47d4ec4fa1647c5a4c8d50f0aa6a2df86ca68c80

subject: Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-08 00:23:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/developing_elements.rst', 'lib/common-functions', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py'], 'message': "Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML

This new variable is a YAML formatted list of the elements chosen for
the build along with their full paths.

This list is intended for consumption of elements who need to copy
files from other elements, such as pkg-map and svc-map.  As discussed
in I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6, this list has already
been pruned and had overrides processed, so it is safe to simply walk
over this list with no further processing.

Since we're presenting the element list in a couple of different ways,
we combine it all into the element-info script.  It will output an
eval-able string that declares the appropriate variables.

I've added some inline documentation so they still appear in grep.
The documentation is updated with examples, and moved to a more
appropriate location as a sub-section of the element sytle guide.

To test this out, use the associative-array in generate_hooks, where
we can now find the element's directory without searching.

Change-Id: Ibbd07d082ec827441def2d3f6240df3efdc6eae3
"}]
commit_message:
Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML

This new variable is a YAML formatted list of the elements chosen for
the build along with their full paths.

This list is intended for consumption of elements who need to copy
files from other elements, such as pkg-map and svc-map.  As discussed
in I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6, this list has already
been pruned and had overrides processed, so it is safe to simply walk
over this list with no further processing.

Since we're presenting the element list in a couple of different ways,
we combine it all into the element-info script.  It will output an
eval-able string that declares the appropriate variables.

I've added some inline documentation so they still appear in grep.
The documentation is updated with examples, and moved to a more
appropriate location as a sub-section of the element sytle guide.

To test this out, use the associative-array in generate_hooks, where
we can now find the element's directory without searching.

Change-Id: Ibbd07d082ec827441def2d3f6240df3efdc6eae3

subject: Making element overriding explicit
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-08 00:23:10.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/tests/test_elementdeps.py', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': 'Making element overriding explicit

This is a re-factor of element_dependencies to achieve two things --
centralising override policy and storing path names.

Firstly we want to make the override policy for elements completely
explicit.  Currently, elements that wish to copy parts of other
elements walk ELEMENTS_PATH themselves and look for elements in
IMAGE_ELEMENT.  How they handle duplicate elements can differ, leading
to inconsistent behaviour.

We introduce logic in element-info to find elements in each of the
directories in ELEMENT_PATHS in *reverse* order -- that is to say,
earlier entries in the paths will overwrite later ones.

For example

 ELEMENT_PATHS=foo:bar:baz

will mean that "foo/element" will override "baz/element", since "foo"
is first.  This should be sane to anyone familiar with $PATH.
Documentation is clarified around this point and a test-case is added.

The second thing is that we want to keep the complete path of the
elements we have chosen.  We want the aforementioned elements that
walk the element list to use these canonical paths to pickup files;
this way they don't need to make local decisions about element
overrides, but can simply iterate a list and copy/merge files if they
exist.

A follow-on change (I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd) will
expose this data in a separate variable that can be parsed by elements
(a further follow-on I0a64b45e9f2cfa28e84b2859d76b065a6c4590f0
modifies the elements to use this information).  Thus this does not
change the status-quo -- elements that are walking ELEMENTS_PATH
themselves and can/will continue doing that.

Change-Id: I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6
'}]
commit_message:
Making element overriding explicit

This is a re-factor of element_dependencies to achieve two things --
centralising override policy and storing path names.

Firstly we want to make the override policy for elements completely
explicit.  Currently, elements that wish to copy parts of other
elements walk ELEMENTS_PATH themselves and look for elements in
IMAGE_ELEMENT.  How they handle duplicate elements can differ, leading
to inconsistent behaviour.

We introduce logic in element-info to find elements in each of the
directories in ELEMENT_PATHS in *reverse* order -- that is to say,
earlier entries in the paths will overwrite later ones.

For example

 ELEMENT_PATHS=foo:bar:baz

will mean that "foo/element" will override "baz/element", since "foo"
is first.  This should be sane to anyone familiar with $PATH.
Documentation is clarified around this point and a test-case is added.

The second thing is that we want to keep the complete path of the
elements we have chosen.  We want the aforementioned elements that
walk the element list to use these canonical paths to pickup files;
this way they don't need to make local decisions about element
overrides, but can simply iterate a list and copy/merge files if they
exist.

A follow-on change (I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd) will
expose this data in a separate variable that can be parsed by elements
(a further follow-on I0a64b45e9f2cfa28e84b2859d76b065a6c4590f0
modifies the elements to use this information).  Thus this does not
change the status-quo -- elements that are walking ELEMENTS_PATH
themselves and can/will continue doing that.

Change-Id: I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6

commit_message:
devstack: fix aodh-api launch

This now uses the pbr wsgi_scripts facility, so the current command line is
invalid. Let's remove -v and -d as debug level is conrtolled by
$ENABLE_DEBUG_LOG_LEVEL. The configfile is hardcoded to the default location in
settings, so there's no neeed to pass it too.

Change-Id: I6d13c17d32017544b8fa8411fdef4af86a7b0a4d
Closes-Bug: #1620880

subject: Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 02:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py'], 'message': 'Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).

NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#4>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable

>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#5>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ia6157f1137300a6c5c4c0e52fd1a46ccc29a9564
Closes-Bug: #1339855
'}]
commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).

NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).

>>> raise NotImplemented()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#4>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplemented()
TypeError: 'NotImplementedType' object is not callable

>>> raise NotImplementedError()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<pyshell#5>", line 1, in <module>
    raise NotImplementedError()
NotImplementedError

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Ia6157f1137300a6c5c4c0e52fd1a46ccc29a9564
Closes-Bug: #1339855

commit_message:
Delete dependencies when deleting a node or cluster

When deleting a node or cluster which has containers running on it,
the action should be forbidden. When deleing a container node, the
dependency information stored in the host node and cluster should
also be removed.

Change-Id: I8a1ddf2c3bdcd048045cce34435ab6cd255e4796

commit_message:
Project domain must match role domain for assignment

When assigning a Domain specific role to a user it is OK if the user
is from a different domain, but the project's domain must match the
role's domain.

Closes-Bug: 1590587
Change-Id: I1d63415de0130794939998c3e142ebdce9ddf39d

subject: Add get_by_desc ret val handling to get_fragment_size
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-08 03:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['src/erasurecode.c', 'include/erasurecode/erasurecode.h'], 'message': 'Add get_by_desc ret val handling to get_fragment_size

As well as any other callers, libersurecode_get_fragment_size should
handle the return value of liberasurecode_get_backend_instance_by_desc.

Otherwise, get_by_desc can return NULL and it causes an invalid memory
access in librerasurecode_get_fragment_size.

Change-Id: I489f8b5d049610863b5e0b477b6ff70ead245b55
'}]
commit_message:
Add get_by_desc ret val handling to get_fragment_size

As well as any other callers, libersurecode_get_fragment_size should
handle the return value of liberasurecode_get_backend_instance_by_desc.

Otherwise, get_by_desc can return NULL and it causes an invalid memory
access in librerasurecode_get_fragment_size.

Change-Id: I489f8b5d049610863b5e0b477b6ff70ead245b55

commit_message:
Separate encryption_types_client from types_client

The is_resource_deleted() of types_client covers both volume_type and
encryption_type and the method interface became different from the
other service client, because the existence check way is different
from both resources. That is not so good for stable interface and
it is nice to separate encryption_type way to simple code.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: If4ecd61d2886d616b677d8bbeaf31646cb1b19cd

subject: Remove six.moves module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 09:04:40.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/tests/unit/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Remove six.moves module

Python 3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions to
different modules. Six provides a consistent interface to them through the
fake six.moves module.

But six.StringIO is an alias for StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and
io.StringIO in Python 3. So we don't need six.moves.StringIO() any more,
we use six.StringIO() directly.

Here is links :http://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves

Change-Id: I44dbe915820ba4b5ffc0e34812fadc3d905542d1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove six.moves module

Python 3 reorganized the standard library and moved several functions to
different modules. Six provides a consistent interface to them through the
fake six.moves module.

But six.StringIO is an alias for StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and
io.StringIO in Python 3. So we don't need six.moves.StringIO() any more,
we use six.StringIO() directly.

Here is links :http://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves
