commit_message:
Better handle vim domain exception

Instead of handling each keystone parameter error in Tacker,
reuse keystone's BadRequest exception that already takes care of
parameter errors in user input not just for domains, but users,
projects and tenants.

Change-Id: I2a6aa6f7f9dec829bf1010d244d1aadf7942ec9d

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.
sys.exit(main())

also see: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c

Change-Id: I3086dc0529c4343f246f543de1b6ee6540438a98
'}]
commit_message:
Make shell main() specify return value in exit code

sys.exit() calls in main() will make the interactive
python interpreter exit. We can call the main() as
below to avoid to exit the interactive interpreter,
and specify the return value of main() in the exit
code at the same time.
sys.exit(main())

also see: I6ead9853fe27e99df3e9121478e906a06839f48c

Change-Id: I3086dc0529c4343f246f543de1b6ee6540438a98

commit_message:
Establish cinder_type after keystone_endpoint

  The commit adds a collector of cinter_type requiring
  Keystone_endpoint if any configure_endpoint parameter is set.

  Without this it is easily possible for resources using the cinder_type
  to run before any endpoints are created, failing the catalog run.

Change-Id: I13a6a44ee28b4b314fd806690ef292da2ebd6cd0
(cherry picked from commit 65851eed7f215a61b7b5915c9d42994868bcebd9)

subject: Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML and get_image_element_array
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 01:11:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer/developing_elements.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/element-vars-c6bf2e6795002f01.yaml', 'lib/common-functions', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py'], 'message': 'Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML and get_image_element_array

These new variables are a list of elements chosen for the build along
with their full paths.  For Python elements, IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML is a
YAML formatted list that can be easily parsed.  For bash elements,
"get_image_element_array" will produce an associative-array of the
same (working around lack of array export in Bash).

This list is intended for consumption of elements who need to copy
files from other elements, such as pkg-map and svc-map.  As discussed
in I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6, this list has already
been pruned and had overrides processed, so it is safe to simply walk
over this list with no further processing.

Since we're presenting the element list in a couple of different ways,
we combine it all into the element-info script.  It will output an
eval-able string that declares the appropriate variables.

I've added some inline documentation so they still appear in grep.
The documentation is updated with examples, and moved to a more
appropriate location as a sub-section of the element sytle guide.

To test this out, use the associative-array in generate_hooks, where
we can now find the element's directory without searching.

Change-Id: Ibbd07d082ec827441def2d3f6240df3efdc6eae3
'}]
commit_message:
Add IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML and get_image_element_array

These new variables are a list of elements chosen for the build along
with their full paths.  For Python elements, IMAGE_ELEMENT_YAML is a
YAML formatted list that can be easily parsed.  For bash elements,
"get_image_element_array" will produce an associative-array of the
same (working around lack of array export in Bash).

This list is intended for consumption of elements who need to copy
files from other elements, such as pkg-map and svc-map.  As discussed
in I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6, this list has already
been pruned and had overrides processed, so it is safe to simply walk
over this list with no further processing.

Since we're presenting the element list in a couple of different ways,
we combine it all into the element-info script.  It will output an
eval-able string that declares the appropriate variables.

I've added some inline documentation so they still appear in grep.
The documentation is updated with examples, and moved to a more
appropriate location as a sub-section of the element sytle guide.

To test this out, use the associative-array in generate_hooks, where
we can now find the element's directory without searching.

Change-Id: Ibbd07d082ec827441def2d3f6240df3efdc6eae3

subject: Making element overriding explicit
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-08 01:11:24.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/element-override-ccda78c24ab4a4ff.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/tests/test_elementdeps.py', 'diskimage_builder/element_dependencies.py', 'doc/source/developer/invocation.rst'], 'message': 'Making element overriding explicit

This is a re-factor of element_dependencies to achieve two things --
centralising override policy and storing path names.

Firstly we want to make the override policy for elements completely
explicit.  Currently, elements that wish to copy parts of other
elements walk ELEMENTS_PATH themselves and look for elements in
IMAGE_ELEMENT.  How they handle duplicate elements can differ, leading
to inconsistent behaviour.

We introduce logic in element-info to find elements in each of the
directories in ELEMENT_PATHS in *reverse* order -- that is to say,
earlier entries in the paths will overwrite later ones.

For example

 ELEMENT_PATHS=foo:bar:baz

will mean that "foo/element" will override "baz/element", since "foo"
is first.  This should be sane to anyone familiar with $PATH.
Documentation is clarified around this point and a test-case is added.

The second thing is that we want to keep the complete path of the
elements we have chosen.  We want the aforementioned elements that
walk the element list to use these canonical paths to pickup files;
this way they don't need to make local decisions about element
overrides, but can simply iterate a list and copy/merge files if they
exist.

A follow-on change (I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd) will
expose this data in a separate variable that can be parsed by elements
(a further follow-on I0a64b45e9f2cfa28e84b2859d76b065a6c4590f0
modifies the elements to use this information).  Thus this does not
change the status-quo -- elements that are walking ELEMENTS_PATH
themselves and can/will continue doing that.

Change-Id: I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6
'}]
commit_message:
Making element overriding explicit

This is a re-factor of element_dependencies to achieve two things --
centralising override policy and storing path names.

Firstly we want to make the override policy for elements completely
explicit.  Currently, elements that wish to copy parts of other
elements walk ELEMENTS_PATH themselves and look for elements in
IMAGE_ELEMENT.  How they handle duplicate elements can differ, leading
to inconsistent behaviour.

We introduce logic in element-info to find elements in each of the
directories in ELEMENT_PATHS in *reverse* order -- that is to say,
earlier entries in the paths will overwrite later ones.

For example

 ELEMENT_PATHS=foo:bar:baz

will mean that "foo/element" will override "baz/element", since "foo"
is first.  This should be sane to anyone familiar with $PATH.
Documentation is clarified around this point and a test-case is added.

The second thing is that we want to keep the complete path of the
elements we have chosen.  We want the aforementioned elements that
walk the element list to use these canonical paths to pickup files;
this way they don't need to make local decisions about element
overrides, but can simply iterate a list and copy/merge files if they
exist.

A follow-on change (I7092e1845942f249175933d67ab121188f3511fd) will
expose this data in a separate variable that can be parsed by elements
(a further follow-on I0a64b45e9f2cfa28e84b2859d76b065a6c4590f0
modifies the elements to use this information).  Thus this does not
change the status-quo -- elements that are walking ELEMENTS_PATH
themselves and can/will continue doing that.

Change-Id: I2a29861c67de2d25c595cb35d850e92807d26ac6

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/backup/drivers/*.py

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases that use
mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some classes in
cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/.

Change-Id: Id4905d0172dd4cbf6fe0006720b8ca2f3f1200c8

commit_message:
Ensure endpoints created before admin_token_auth

  This commit will establish that all endpoints are created before the
  admin_token_auth is removed from the authentication pipeline.

  Without this you can no guarantee that all required endpoints are
  bootstrapped properly on initial puppet run.

Change-Id: I43b4ca8d623c2447e722fd521a5375f828858802
(cherry picked from commit 04d49698b12539e8494b01ecff415aee8975c3c5)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-07 02:46:51.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'message': "Turn off bindep

bindep installs a slew of stuff we don't really need and doesn't add
much if any value.  This only turns on bindeps that are required.

This shaves about 3 minutes off each gate run.

Closes-Bug: #1620865
Change-Id: I24df4f2a30c682c1b09e89c7c52f7608582da1a6
"}]
commit_message:
Turn off bindep

bindep installs a slew of stuff we don't really need and doesn't add
much if any value.  This only turns on bindeps that are required.

This shaves about 3 minutes off each gate run.

Closes-Bug: #1620865
Change-Id: I24df4f2a30c682c1b09e89c7c52f7608582da1a6

commit_message:
Tweak not found exception handling

Use ResourceNotFound class to unify class NodeNotFound,
ClusterNotFound, PolicyNotFound, PolicyNotFound.

This patch also added an 'enhance_msg' function to fine tune the message
text.

Add '.' analysis in class SenlinException.

Change-Id: I0fc07858739b909577bcfbb0fb07704353db9d1e

commit_message:
Revert "Switch fernet to be the default token provider"

This reverts commit 181588b9ba50fefea12617a9a5e774daddfed20c.

Since this change landed on 4/29 it's been the cause of the
top two gate failures (besides known latent infra issues) and
hasn't had good progress on landing a fix, so until it's a
priority for the keystone team we need to revert this change
to get the integrated gate jobs moving again.

Change-Id: I588a84c5179eab072d21bc1394aea2df00929650
Related-Bug: #1577558
Related-Bug: #1578866

subject: Update reno for stable/newton
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/newton.rst', 'releasenotes/source/index.rst'], 'message': 'Update reno for stable/newton

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Id5b7f4216a9a55249601827896703a6c87991eba
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update reno for stable/newton

In order to support automatically updating the release notes when we
create stable branches, we want the pages to be in a standard order.
This patch updates the order to be reverse chronological, so the most
recent notes appear at the top.

Change-Id: Id5b7f4216a9a55249601827896703a6c87991eba
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
XenAPI: correct polling on memory_usage

Currently the memory_usage polled is the allocated memory size;
but it should be "Volume of RAM used by the instance from the amount
of its allocated memory" per the meter definition.

Change-Id: I5b1499a98d4e9873e5ae98c3b2cd430ac3c733eb

subject: Fix error handling in proxy/controllers/base.py.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 17363, 'name': 'Timur Alperovich', 'email': 'timur@timuralp.com', 'username': 'timuralp'}, {'_account_id': 18334, 'name': 'Nandini Tata', 'email': 'nandini.tata@intel.com', 'username': 'ntata'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 21:48:51.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'Fix error handling in proxy/controllers/base.py.

There are a few issues going on in the
controllers/base.py:_get_response_parts_iter(). One is that the
"raise" statement that attempts to re-raise the GeneratorExit, may
re-raise ValueError if that was the last exception caught.

Secondly, the range may not actually be set in the backend_headers
(need to investigate further, as that could actually be faulty tests,
since learn_size_from_content_range should always set it). The patch
changes the Range construction to throw a ValueError if None is passed
in that case.

Lastly, the range may be only half-defined, e.g. bytes=0-. In that
case, the check of how many bytes are expected vs how many bytes have
been sent does not make sense.

Change-Id: Ida5adf3d33c736240b2c4bae5510b5289f03dee2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling in proxy/controllers/base.py.

There are a few issues going on in the
controllers/base.py:_get_response_parts_iter(). One is that the
"raise" statement that attempts to re-raise the GeneratorExit, may
re-raise ValueError if that was the last exception caught.

Secondly, the range may not actually be set in the backend_headers
(need to investigate further, as that could actually be faulty tests,
since learn_size_from_content_range should always set it). The patch
changes the Range construction to throw a ValueError if None is passed
in that case.

Lastly, the range may be only half-defined, e.g. bytes=0-. In that
case, the check of how many bytes are expected vs how many bytes have
been sent does not make sense.

Change-Id: Ida5adf3d33c736240b2c4bae5510b5289f03dee2

commit_message:
Disable sahara tests in tempest

Sahara is not enabled by default in TripleO and if it's
deployed it has a heavy problem with performance on CI,
so let's disable its tests for now.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-06 19:57:28.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/volume/base/admin/base_types_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/v1/json/admin/types_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/v2/json/admin/types_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/base/admin/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove base_types_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from the
other services and it is a little difficult to read and debug because
that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization, but actually the merit
seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I0d59b16d706ca3ca0bf629b1374530cc5927b7c2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove base_types_client for the reability

The service clients for the volume service are different from the
other services and it is a little difficult to read and debug because
that consists of multiple layers for v1 and v2.
That could be useful for the code optimization, but actually the merit
seems small and unreadable.
This patch removes these layers from the volume clients.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I0d59b16d706ca3ca0bf629b1374530cc5927b7c2

Keystone re-enable catalog caching

Catalog caching was disabled due to bug 1537617, but this has been
fixed for some time. Re-enabling to get some performance back.

Related-Bug: 1537617

commit_message:
Fix backup unit test with new os-brick

This patch is a temporary fix to accessing FakeConnector from
os-brick.  In 1.6.0 the FakeConnector moved into it's own file
and we need to account for the old version and the new version's location.

Change-Id: I713d32d64eeefab164301d087755df768cc858d5
Partial-Bug: 1618697

subject: Removing Keystone middleware configurations in neutron paste file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 10:04:06.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_server_spec.rb', 'manifests/server.pp'], 'message': 'Removing Keystone middleware configurations in neutron paste file

Keystone auth configurations are being added to neutron.conf and
api-paste.ini both files, which leads to duplication of auth
configurations. If we change the keystone auth configurations in
neutron.conf, still they wont be reflected as in api-paste.ini
there are previous details. To get away from this issue removed
keystone configurations in api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I3ded75d8e6c14d94b015d839d9fc876f21fe98f4
Closes-Bug: #1513532
'}]
commit_message:
Removing Keystone middleware configurations in neutron paste file

Keystone auth configurations are being added to neutron.conf and
api-paste.ini both files, which leads to duplication of auth
configurations. If we change the keystone auth configurations in
neutron.conf, still they wont be reflected as in api-paste.ini
there are previous details. To get away from this issue removed
keystone configurations in api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I3ded75d8e6c14d94b015d839d9fc876f21fe98f4
Closes-Bug: #1513532

subject: Careful with OS::Nova::Server dependencies on subnets
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-25 02:45:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server.py'], 'message': 'Careful with OS::Nova::Server dependencies on subnets

A server within a template may depend on networks and, implicitly,
subnets, created within the same template. When we are calculating
dependencies for the server, play it safe and add any subnets as
dependencies whose network is not yet known. Note, this defensiveness
only takes places when subnets specify their network by reference,
rather by network id or name.

Change-Id: Ifda0a70b40e6f255b9ee462e8af7f11a0b2d5d6c
Closes-Bug: #1546201
'}]
commit_message:
Careful with OS::Nova::Server dependencies on subnets

A server within a template may depend on networks and, implicitly,
subnets, created within the same template. When we are calculating
dependencies for the server, play it safe and add any subnets as
dependencies whose network is not yet known. Note, this defensiveness
only takes places when subnets specify their network by reference,
rather by network id or name.

Change-Id: Ifda0a70b40e6f255b9ee462e8af7f11a0b2d5d6c
Closes-Bug: #1546201

subject: gnocchi: move statsd and metricd at step5
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 19:01:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/statsd.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/gnocchi/metricd.pp'], 'message': 'gnocchi: move statsd and metricd at step5

Gnocchi statsd and metricd require Keystone resources to be in place
when using Swift backend, because those services will try to access to
Swift containers.

To do so, we want to move the service start at step 5 instead of 4 and
also require Keystone resource to be managed before starting the
services.

Change-Id: Ie5bc1481a8700c7cd080a76d0978146a84825767
Closes-Bug: #1621164
'}]
commit_message:
gnocchi: move statsd and metricd at step5

Gnocchi statsd and metricd require Keystone resources to be in place
when using Swift backend, because those services will try to access to
Swift containers.

To do so, we want to move the service start at step 5 instead of 4 and
also require Keystone resource to be managed before starting the
services.

Change-Id: Ie5bc1481a8700c7cd080a76d0978146a84825767
Closes-Bug: #1621164

subject: Derive the OpenStack service list from the service file
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-07 18:39:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/sources-branch-updater.sh'], 'message': "Derive the OpenStack service list from the service file

This patch updates the sources-branch-updater to derive the OpenStack
service list from the service file provided on the CLI.

It will only pick up OpenStack git sources and will deliberately ignore
repositories which include a '-' in the name, as those are drivers or
plugins, not services. Drivers/plugins don't contain conf/policy files
which need updating with every SHA bump.

The requirements repo is also deliberately ignored as it contains no
services which require conf/policy file updates.

Change-Id: I51ad9e5e48da18cb46ccf9cfe12118c19c2a1f53
"}]
commit_message:
Derive the OpenStack service list from the service file

This patch updates the sources-branch-updater to derive the OpenStack
service list from the service file provided on the CLI.

It will only pick up OpenStack git sources and will deliberately ignore
repositories which include a '-' in the name, as those are drivers or
plugins, not services. Drivers/plugins don't contain conf/policy files
which need updating with every SHA bump.

The requirements repo is also deliberately ignored as it contains no
services which require conf/policy file updates.

Change-Id: I51ad9e5e48da18cb46ccf9cfe12118c19c2a1f53

This patch allows the ack processing behavior to be configured based

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Make the default settlement behavior configurable

This patch allows the ack processing behavior to be configured based
on the type of message sent.  This allows the proper ack behavior for
a given backend to be customized. By default Cast messages are now
sent pre-acked (best effort).

Change-Id: I0d4e44a7a87f3c917a3eb44f6e02af74a9af10a5
Closes-Bug: #1616612

subject: Fix swarm functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 19:01:32.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/functional/swarm/test_swarm_python_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix swarm functional tests

We are using the tcp protocol for swarm in template_def
of the swarm driver and docker-py before 1.8.0 has a bug
in authenticating with tls using tcp.

Use https in the swarm functional tests.

Change-Id: I32b58cf567f4ae5597d9207b81f8546d1062b8b9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swarm functional tests

We are using the tcp protocol for swarm in template_def
of the swarm driver and docker-py before 1.8.0 has a bug
in authenticating with tls using tcp.

Use https in the swarm functional tests.

Change-Id: I32b58cf567f4ae5597d9207b81f8546d1062b8b9

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects instead
of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should import
modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I863d4433a69712cfda5f8df89e55a6ca2f820f64

The VDU VM's dead simulation depends on metadata service which needs
virtual routers, or config drive.

This patch adds "config_drive: true" to all templates which need user
data.

In addition, some verbose debug information is inserted into code to
help to diagnose problem.

Change-Id: I066ce769de17ad3179193b436f5a644b76233a1e
Closes-bug: #1617923
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the monitor bug

The VDU VM's dead simulation depends on metadata service which needs
virtual routers, or config drive.

This patch adds "config_drive: true" to all templates which need user
data.

In addition, some verbose debug information is inserted into code to
help to diagnose problem.

Change-Id: I066ce769de17ad3179193b436f5a644b76233a1e
Closes-bug: #1617923

commit_message:
Stop using mox in unit/api/v3/ tests

As mox is not compatible with python 3, all test cases
that use mox should be updated to use mock instead.

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some classes in
cinder/tests/unit/api/v3/*.py.

Renamed stubs.py to fakes.py since the old name was not
reasonable anymore.

Change-Id: Ia61102592d7a703d95d8df8376fc6d0b531df91b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-20 01:27:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py'], 'message': 'Return None in get_instance_id_by_floating_address

_show_port() can raise a PortNotFound exception, but the method
get_instance_id_by_floating_address() doesn't handle it. On the
other hand, the method returns None if fip doesn't contain
port_id as a normal case.
On the caller side, "Delete a floating ip" API can use the returned
value None to disassociate_and_release_floating_ip() and the method
handles the None as a normal value.

So this patch makes get_instance_id_by_floating_address return None
if PortNotFound happens.

Closes-Bug: #1586931

Change-Id: I03be8100155d343eb6a4ea9eda3f1498ad3fb4cf
(cherry picked from commit e72826123bfd7c1d962b615da3f028b315ba3943)
'}]
commit_message:
Return None in get_instance_id_by_floating_address

_show_port() can raise a PortNotFound exception, but the method
get_instance_id_by_floating_address() doesn't handle it. On the
other hand, the method returns None if fip doesn't contain
port_id as a normal case.
On the caller side, "Delete a floating ip" API can use the returned
value None to disassociate_and_release_floating_ip() and the method
handles the None as a normal value.

So this patch makes get_instance_id_by_floating_address return None
if PortNotFound happens.

Closes-Bug: #1586931

Change-Id: I03be8100155d343eb6a4ea9eda3f1498ad3fb4cf
(cherry picked from commit e72826123bfd7c1d962b615da3f028b315ba3943)

subject: Attempt to not set location on non active or queued image
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 7575, 'name': 'Sabari', 'email': 'smurugesan@vmware.com', 'username': 'sabari'}, {'_account_id': 11676, 'name': 'wuyuting', 'email': 'wytdahu@gmail.com', 'username': 'wuyuting'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}, {'_account_id': 17116, 'name': 'Niall Bunting', 'email': 'niall.bunting@hpe.com', 'username': 'NiallBunting'}, {'_account_id': 22448, 'name': 'Alexander Bashmakov', 'email': 'abashmak@yahoo.com', 'username': 'abashmak'}, {'_account_id': 22834, 'name': 'liwei', 'email': 'wei.li@easystack.cn', 'username': 'liwei1'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-31 22:10:10.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'message': 'Attempt to not set location on non active or queued image

Currently, an authorized user can set custom location string
to an image that is in any non-deleted status.

If a custom location is set to an image in ``saving`` status, it may
result in a race condition between the data stream that is trying to
save the image data to the backend and the custom location user is
attempting to set on the image record. This will result in a bad
experience for the user who is streaming the image data to Glance as
it is a better experiece to set the location after the image data has
been saved and image is in ``active`` status, in this case.

If a custom location is set to an image in ``deactivated`` status, the
purpose of setting the image to ``deactivated`` is void. This will
result in a worse experience for the security team that is trying to
evaluate the validity of the image data of the deactivated image.
Avoiding setting custom location in this case will ensure data
consistency until image is pulled out of the deactivation process.

This commit introduces the following change in behavior:
  * If an image is in ``saving`` or ``deactivated`` status, the staus of
    that image will be checked while trying to set the custom location
    and a HTTP 409 Conflict status will be retured in response to the
    user.
  * If an image is in ``active`` or ``queued`` status, setting custom
    locations on that image will be allowed so there is no change in
    behavior for this case.
  * If an image is in ``deleted`` or ``pending_delete`` status, a HTTP
    409 Conflict status will be retured, if that image is visible to the
    user (in case of admins). Otherwise, the location cannot be set
    anyway. Setting a location to a ``deleted`` image is fruitless as
    the image cannot be used. Please note ``pending_delete`` is another
    form of the ``deleted`` status and behavior in either case should be
    expected to be same.
  * If an image is in ``killed`` status, a HTTP 409 Conflict status will
    be retured. Nevertheless, it is again fruitless to attempt to set a
    location on such images as they are unusable.
  * This operation still involves the following race conditions:
     * In case where the status of the image is ``saving`` and it
       has just moved to ```active`` status, ideally setting custom
       location should be allowed however, due to lack of atomicity in
       setting image status glance will ignore setting the location and
       a 409 will be returned.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``deactivated`` and it
       has just been moved to ``active`` status, ideally setting
       custom location should be allowed however, due to lack of
       atomicity in setting image status glance will ignore setting
       the location and a 409 will be returned.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``active`` and it has
       just been moved to ``deactivated`` status, due to lack of
       atomicity in setting image status, glance may set another
       location on that image.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``queued`` and it has
       just been moved to ``saving`` status, due to lack of atomicity
       in setting image status, glance may set another location on
       that image.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``queued`` or ``active``
       and location is attempted to be set on it, if the image first
       goes into ``deleted``, ``pending_delete`` or ``killed`` status
       then the user will get a HTTP 409 Conflict status back. This
       occurs again due to lack of atomicity in setting image status.

Please note:
  * We will plan to add further granularity in setting locations to the
    images atomically in subsequent commits.
  * Fow now, though, this commit does resolve the issue of setting
    locations on an image incorrectly (in unexpected circumstances) to a
    significant degree. So, this is good progress in ensuring rightful
    use of the image locations feature.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie463e2f30db94cde7716c83a94ec2fb0c0658c91
Lite-Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324780/
Partial-Bug: 1587985
'}]
commit_message:
Attempt to not set location on non active or queued image

Currently, an authorized user can set custom location string
to an image that is in any non-deleted status.

If a custom location is set to an image in ``saving`` status, it may
result in a race condition between the data stream that is trying to
save the image data to the backend and the custom location user is
attempting to set on the image record. This will result in a bad
experience for the user who is streaming the image data to Glance as
it is a better experiece to set the location after the image data has
been saved and image is in ``active`` status, in this case.

If a custom location is set to an image in ``deactivated`` status, the
purpose of setting the image to ``deactivated`` is void. This will
result in a worse experience for the security team that is trying to
evaluate the validity of the image data of the deactivated image.
Avoiding setting custom location in this case will ensure data
consistency until image is pulled out of the deactivation process.

This commit introduces the following change in behavior:
  * If an image is in ``saving`` or ``deactivated`` status, the staus of
    that image will be checked while trying to set the custom location
    and a HTTP 409 Conflict status will be retured in response to the
    user.
  * If an image is in ``active`` or ``queued`` status, setting custom
    locations on that image will be allowed so there is no change in
    behavior for this case.
  * If an image is in ``deleted`` or ``pending_delete`` status, a HTTP
    409 Conflict status will be retured, if that image is visible to the
    user (in case of admins). Otherwise, the location cannot be set
    anyway. Setting a location to a ``deleted`` image is fruitless as
    the image cannot be used. Please note ``pending_delete`` is another
    form of the ``deleted`` status and behavior in either case should be
    expected to be same.
  * If an image is in ``killed`` status, a HTTP 409 Conflict status will
    be retured. Nevertheless, it is again fruitless to attempt to set a
    location on such images as they are unusable.
  * This operation still involves the following race conditions:
     * In case where the status of the image is ``saving`` and it
       has just moved to ```active`` status, ideally setting custom
       location should be allowed however, due to lack of atomicity in
       setting image status glance will ignore setting the location and
       a 409 will be returned.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``deactivated`` and it
       has just been moved to ``active`` status, ideally setting
       custom location should be allowed however, due to lack of
       atomicity in setting image status glance will ignore setting
       the location and a 409 will be returned.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``active`` and it has
       just been moved to ``deactivated`` status, due to lack of
       atomicity in setting image status, glance may set another
       location on that image.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``queued`` and it has
       just been moved to ``saving`` status, due to lack of atomicity
       in setting image status, glance may set another location on
       that image.
     * In case where the status of the image is ``queued`` or ``active``
       and location is attempted to be set on it, if the image first
       goes into ``deleted``, ``pending_delete`` or ``killed`` status
       then the user will get a HTTP 409 Conflict status back. This
       occurs again due to lack of atomicity in setting image status.

Please note:
  * We will plan to add further granularity in setting locations to the
    images atomically in subsequent commits.
  * Fow now, though, this commit does resolve the issue of setting
    locations on an image incorrectly (in unexpected circumstances) to a
    significant degree. So, this is good progress in ensuring rightful
    use of the image locations feature.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ie463e2f30db94cde7716c83a94ec2fb0c0658c91
Lite-Spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324780/
Partial-Bug: 1587985

Add explicit dependencies to pass puppet4

  provision profile.

  change in default run order.

commit_message:
Add regions in ring-builder.py

swift-ring-builder CLI usage does not specify about regions.
This patch adds a description about it. It also adds
a brief description of the flags (report parameter).

Change-Id: If51a15c0904857abf62636b90ac0c7ed63300871
Closes-Bug: #1583551

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-29 17:55:59.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': 'Establish cinder_type after keystone_endpoint

  The commit adds a collector of cinter_type requiring
  Keystone_endpoint if any configure_endpoint parameter is set.

  Without this it is easily possible for resources using the cinder_type
  to run before any endpoints are created, failing the catalog run.

Change-Id: I13a6a44ee28b4b314fd806690ef292da2ebd6cd0
'}]
commit_message:
Establish cinder_type after keystone_endpoint

  The commit adds a collector of cinter_type requiring
  Keystone_endpoint if any configure_endpoint parameter is set.

  Without this it is easily possible for resources using the cinder_type
  to run before any endpoints are created, failing the catalog run.

Change-Id: I13a6a44ee28b4b314fd806690ef292da2ebd6cd0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 18:56:24.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/disable_admin_token_auth.pp'], 'message': 'Ensure endpoints created before admin_token_auth

  This commit will establish that all endpoints are created before the
  admin_token_auth is removed from the authentication pipeline.

  Without this you can no guarantee that all required endpoints are
  bootstrapped properly on initial puppet run.

Change-Id: I43b4ca8d623c2447e722fd521a5375f828858802
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure endpoints created before admin_token_auth

  This commit will establish that all endpoints are created before the
  admin_token_auth is removed from the authentication pipeline.

  Without this you can no guarantee that all required endpoints are
  bootstrapped properly on initial puppet run.

Change-Id: I43b4ca8d623c2447e722fd521a5375f828858802

subject: Reduce the default fact gather subset
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-07 17:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ansible-fact-subset-08e582fcf7ba4e4e.yaml', 'scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/openstack-ansible.rc'], 'message': 'Reduce the default fact gather subset

This patch implements a new default subset of facts being gathered
to a much smaller set. This should improve performance in large
environments. Deployers who need a greater subset are able to use
the standard Ansible environment variables to override our default
value.

Change-Id: I741228ba03ad5081fbea5833143fdf1f1e8d3623
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce the default fact gather subset

This patch implements a new default subset of facts being gathered
to a much smaller set. This should improve performance in large
environments. Deployers who need a greater subset are able to use
the standard Ansible environment variables to override our default
value.

Change-Id: I741228ba03ad5081fbea5833143fdf1f1e8d3623

subject: Update tox.ini files from release-tools gold copy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 22:02:29.000000000', 'files': ['src/tox.ini', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update tox.ini files from release-tools gold copy

All OpenStack Charms now contain identical tox.ini files,
not to be modified or made unique within each charm repo.

This is to ensure consistency across charm repos in tox
target naming, approach and purpose, also giving the
charm dev and test experience additional consistency.

Change-Id: Ie3752edbe5fc9518e2d31ea27e805d2812e1b76b
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini files from release-tools gold copy

All OpenStack Charms now contain identical tox.ini files,
not to be modified or made unique within each charm repo.

This is to ensure consistency across charm repos in tox
target naming, approach and purpose, also giving the
charm dev and test experience additional consistency.

Change-Id: Ie3752edbe5fc9518e2d31ea27e805d2812e1b76b

commit_message:
Add `-k` option to curl call in waitcondition test

This option needed for running test on environments with enabled SSL.
Also change template for this test to make it ready to debug. Now
you have instance with floating ip and outputs with needed urls.

Change-Id: Iaa0f4549586e3c421e3b7fe4573a61e0131d2e9e

revisions:

Add --incremental flag to backup-create and set the default
value to False. When the flag is passed it will create a
backup based on the last good known full/incremental backup.
If there is no previous backup a full backup will be created.

Change-Id: I6fcd60f6068dfb0145fa64248a2d8b3fdfc1004d

Partial-Bug: #1607429
'}]
commit_message:
Add --incremental flag to backup-create

Add --incremental flag to backup-create and set the default
value to False. When the flag is passed it will create a
backup based on the last good known full/incremental backup.
If there is no previous backup a full backup will be created.

Change-Id: I6fcd60f6068dfb0145fa64248a2d8b3fdfc1004d
Depends-On: I96498180890b8b1692b1bac3b19988532f6eb077
Partial-Bug: #1607429

In order to allow clusters to be all on the same hypervisor
(affinity) or all on different hypervisors (anti-affinity) a new

commit_message:
Locality support for clusters

In order to allow clusters to be all on the same hypervisor
(affinity) or all on different hypervisors (anti-affinity) a new
argument (locality) needed to be added to the Trove cluster-create API.

This changeset addresses the Trove server part of this feature.
'locality' can now be added to the ReST payload for a cluster-create
command and it is passed along as a scheduler hint to Nova.

The cluster scenario tests were enhanced to test that 'affinity'
works. Testing that 'anti-affinity' fails proved to be too
time consuming, since at present the only way for a cluster to
'fail' is to timeout (and that takes 10 hours).

The server-group is checked to make sure it is created properly,
and that it has been deleted after all the related instances are gone.

DocImpact: New functionality

Partially implements: blueprint replication-cluster-locality
Depends-On: Ie46cfa69ffe6a64760aca38c495563f5724bd0d0

Change-Id: I657bf5c023d0257e462cc39f57c16eb6ee83807a

While multiple passwords are stored for a user, only the latest one is

commit_message:
Keep the order of passwords in tests

While multiple passwords are stored for a user, only the latest one is
used for authentication. When `created_at` in tests get changed, the
order of password might change too.

Keep the order of passwords by giving earlier passwords an earlier date
of creation.

Change-Id: I68861bc5c379dcf1cf060081f7802917d6f0c4b9

land on an environment.

The bug was deep in the SQL, and can only be tested by testing the

commit_message:
correctly join the usage to inventory for capacity accounting

This updates the SQL code to match the comment about how the tables
should be joined. It also adds a detailed warning when we go over
capacity, that will be useful to developers and operators when fail to
land on an environment.

The bug was deep in the SQL, and can only be tested by testing the
SQL, which we may want to do later. In leiu of a unit test, an
additional safety check is put in the code that if we ever end up with
multiple records with the same key, we explode with a KeyError.

Closes-Bug: #1620736

Change-Id: Ic3f83a881e7d98fc6ed007b62a179b3153190543

If openrc is sourced to env while running the glance puppet module
all its providers are failing. Other modules like nova and neutron
clear the env first and then perform the provider actions.
Added the code support to do the same in puppet-glance

Change-Id: Ib2c73d8c9300c455d10a4c25f0ba5d4821d3f671
Closes-Bug: #1524599

commit_message:
Clearing openrc env values to avoid glance providers failing

If openrc is sourced to env while running the glance puppet module
all its providers are failing. Other modules like nova and neutron
clear the env first and then perform the provider actions.
Added the code support to do the same in puppet-glance

Change-Id: Ib2c73d8c9300c455d10a4c25f0ba5d4821d3f671
Closes-Bug: #1524599

subject: virsh commands fail for ceph due to libvirt service not running
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-12 10:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/compute/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': 'virsh commands fail for ceph due to libvirt service not running

When we are using ceph as backend for nova it needs to create
secret.xml file and has to run virsh comands to make sure ceph
to be its backend. While installing with puppet as libvirt is
not getting started be default while running the virsh commands.
Updated code to have libvirt service running as dependency
before executing virsh commands to have ceph as backend.

Change-Id: I14afe7e2a690ba9ecb35b95ce74e98c35d9abe0e
Closed-Bug: #1542445
'}]
commit_message:
virsh commands fail for ceph due to libvirt service not running

When we are using ceph as backend for nova it needs to create
secret.xml file and has to run virsh comands to make sure ceph
to be its backend. While installing with puppet as libvirt is
not getting started be default while running the virsh commands.
Updated code to have libvirt service running as dependency
before executing virsh commands to have ceph as backend.

Change-Id: I14afe7e2a690ba9ecb35b95ce74e98c35d9abe0e
Closed-Bug: #1542445

commit_message:
Initial work for multinode support

* Basic Ansible playbook structure.
* Basic bash script to run playbooks.

* Create run_multinode.sh that will install & run ansible
* Prepare basic playbooks structure:
  - localhost pre-task: prepare inventiry
  - zuul role: install zuul-cloner and clone project repo
  - integration role: clone modules re-using install_modules.sh

This is a first attempt to run multi-node jobs.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I3a41e6f4300fb3eeef61215c01a5f5fa5a9a56bc

commit_message:
Allow to set allow_resize_to_same_host in nova-api

To be able to resize a ephemeral node, we need to set
allow_resize_to_same_host to true in nova-api.

By default the value will be set to false as the openstack default.

Closes-bug: #1535606

Change-Id: Ib3e0d53c1c219fd6d83f940053b833163c51dcb3
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>

subject: Override Service provider for mon and rgw services
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-01-12 22:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/rgw.pp', 'manifests/mon.pp', 'spec/defines/ceph_mon_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Override Service provider for mon and rgw services

On RHEL7 systems, the default Service provider is systemd.  This means
that RHEL7 hosts cheerfully ignore the explicit `status` option provided
to the `mon` and `rgw` services, which means that systemd always finds
the services in a "stopped" state because this command fails:
```
Debug: Executing '/bin/systemctl is-active mon.ceph1'
```

After this change is applied, Puppet will correctly use the `status`
command defined in these manifests:
```
Debug: Executing 'service ceph status mon.ceph1'
```

This uses the `$::osfamily` fact on RedHat and derivative systems, and
the `$::operatingsystem` fact on Debian.

Update tests to ensure that RHEL7 passes:
* set `operatingsystem` fact to "RedHat"
* set `operatingsystemmajrelease` to "7"
* change `$mon_data/sysvinit` to `$mon_data/redhat`

There are no Debian-specific tests in the original tests, and I did not
add any.

Change-Id: I6da6931d564550aa34e9aad42f31164a0347aecd
'}]
commit_message:
Override Service provider for mon and rgw services

On RHEL7 systems, the default Service provider is systemd.  This means
that RHEL7 hosts cheerfully ignore the explicit `status` option provided
to the `mon` and `rgw` services, which means that systemd always finds
the services in a "stopped" state because this command fails:
```
Debug: Executing '/bin/systemctl is-active mon.ceph1'
```

After this change is applied, Puppet will correctly use the `status`
command defined in these manifests:
```
Debug: Executing 'service ceph status mon.ceph1'
```

This uses the `$::osfamily` fact on RedHat and derivative systems, and
the `$::operatingsystem` fact on Debian.

Update tests to ensure that RHEL7 passes:
* set `operatingsystem` fact to "RedHat"
* set `operatingsystemmajrelease` to "7"
* change `$mon_data/sysvinit` to `$mon_data/redhat`

There are no Debian-specific tests in the original tests, and I did not
add any.

Change-Id: I6da6931d564550aa34e9aad42f31164a0347aecd

commit_message:
Signed-off-by: eariasn <eariasn@us.ibm.com>

Added swift_hash_path_suffix and swift_hash_path_prefix are used as part of the
the hashing algorithm when determining data placement in the cluster.
These values should remain secret and MUST NOT change
once a cluster has been deployed.

subject: Fixed issue with rabbit_ha_queues parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-07 10:14:56.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Fixed issue with rabbit_ha_queues parameter

We need to configure rabbit_ha_queues = True only if we have
more than 1 RabbitMQ host. In we have one RabbitMQ host we need to
set rabbit_ha_queues = False.
We also need to use one pattern for configuration of this parameter
for different OpenStack components.

Change-Id: I31685d5f6021e3007274d16400bb71f80c7710a2
Closes-Bug: #1470054
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbit_ha_queues parameter

We need to configure rabbit_ha_queues = True only if we have
more than 1 RabbitMQ host. In we have one RabbitMQ host we need to
set rabbit_ha_queues = False.
We also need to use one pattern for configuration of this parameter
for different OpenStack components.

Change-Id: I31685d5f6021e3007274d16400bb71f80c7710a2
Closes-Bug: #1470054

commit_message:
Add swift-informant middleware support

Swift-informant is a proxy middleware to send events to a statsd
instance[1]

This commit add support to configure swift-informant middleware, since
it's not a default middleware it installation is out of the escope of
this implementation

[1] https://github.com/pandemicsyn/swift-informant

Change-Id: Ib98e21f8a2ec381d4c080192dda61e8dfa0c534a

According to the docs, the option 'stack_user_domain' has been
deprecated and is replaced with either 'stack_user_domain_id' or
'stack_user_domain_name'. Seeing as we can use a domain name, the
heat_domain_id_setter becomes obsolete, since we no longer need
to get the id from the name, we can just use the name.

Change-Id: Icb53c40a9caf903ac14660d8a185ff79c7813602
"}]
commit_message:
Update heat domain

According to the docs, the option 'stack_user_domain' has been
deprecated and is replaced with either 'stack_user_domain_id' or
'stack_user_domain_name'. Seeing as we can use a domain name, the
heat_domain_id_setter becomes obsolete, since we no longer need
to get the id from the name, we can just use the name.

Change-Id: Icb53c40a9caf903ac14660d8a185ff79c7813602

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbit_ha_queues parameter

We need to configure rabbit_ha_queues = True only if we have
more than 1 RabbitMQ host. In we have one RabbitMQ host we need to
set rabbit_ha_queues = False.
We also need to use one pattern for configuration of this parameter
for different OpenStack components.

Change-Id: I2a1400ff6c22c4e3f1ec552e44c56e576ce257f4
Closes-Bug: #1470054

commit_message:
Fixed issue with rabbit_ha_queues parameter

We need to configure rabbit_ha_queues = True only if we have
more than 1 RabbitMQ host. In we have one RabbitMQ host we need to
set rabbit_ha_queues = False.
We also need to use one pattern for configuration of this parameter
for different OpenStack components.

Also fixed issue with rabbit_hosts parameter, removed duplicated
docstring and changed default value because we should initialize
it with array, not with string or boolen value.

Change-Id: I5953260671c445ac3dab691f30c6438ac7005f10
Closes-Bug: #1470054

commit_message:
Enable nova service by default

This commit updates the default value for enable in nova api,
generic_service, compute, conductor and scheduler to true. Without this
change the nova service is not enabled by default resulting in a
different behavior than with other puppet openstack modules.
Associated tests are updated to expect the change in defaults.

Change-Id: Id7f6c550f5eea61cb3432287943b601beb817b9e
Closes-bug: #1220473

commit_message:
Resource keystone_group for Keystone V3 API

With Keystone API V3 support the group capability is now available as keystone
custom type/provider by implementing [1].

Manifest example:
keystone_group { 'group_name::domain_name':
  ensure       => present,
  description  => 'Group',
  users        => ['admin::admin_domain','foo::domain1'],
}

For updating group:
- A group's domain cannot be changed [2]

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/api/v3/identity-api-v3.html#groups-v3-groups
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1475132

Change-Id: Ib8f35df937401c0d541ab0baa178e8e8a6d39766

subject: Add Apache 2.4 proxy_fastcgi support for radosgw
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-13 20:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/rgw/apache.pp', '.gitignore', 'spec/defines/ceph_rgw_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add Apache 2.4 proxy_fastcgi support for radosgw

This has been tested on RHEL7 systems using Red Hat Ceph Storage
packages (by ensuring that ceph::profile::params::manage_repo is false).
Additional work may be necessary to support Debian and Ubuntu versions
that provide Apache 2.4 version 2.4.9 and above.

Support fastcgi and fcgi in ceph::rgw::apache, rather than use separate
defined types for Apache and Apache 2.4.

This allows for a single manifest to support both fastcgi and
proxy_fcgi.  The latter is the default for RHEL 7 systems, unless
otherwise specified.

Renamed several param names to remove the redundant "rgw_" prefix. Since
this defined type is for radosgw, that prefix seems redundant.

Support HTTPS for the Apache virtual host.

Changed default for `ceph_apache_repo` to false.

ignore the log directory

Resolve lint warnings
* provide explicit default case, which should never be reached
* use top-scope lookup on ::apache::mod::fastcgi inclusion

Change-Id: I7f5dff32083795e0b362e6f6a176fe0a54115e19
'}]
commit_message:
Add Apache 2.4 proxy_fastcgi support for radosgw

This has been tested on RHEL7 systems using Red Hat Ceph Storage
packages (by ensuring that ceph::profile::params::manage_repo is false).
Additional work may be necessary to support Debian and Ubuntu versions
that provide Apache 2.4 version 2.4.9 and above.

Support fastcgi and fcgi in ceph::rgw::apache, rather than use separate
defined types for Apache and Apache 2.4.

This allows for a single manifest to support both fastcgi and
proxy_fcgi.  The latter is the default for RHEL 7 systems, unless
otherwise specified.

Renamed several param names to remove the redundant "rgw_" prefix. Since
this defined type is for radosgw, that prefix seems redundant.

Support HTTPS for the Apache virtual host.

Changed default for `ceph_apache_repo` to false.

ignore the log directory

Resolve lint warnings
* provide explicit default case, which should never be reached
* use top-scope lookup on ::apache::mod::fastcgi inclusion

Change-Id: I7f5dff32083795e0b362e6f6a176fe0a54115e19

subject: Support identity_uri and auth_uri properly and add auth_version option
revisions:

This change aligns this module with others like heat, neutron, et al, by
not automatically generating identity_uri and forcing it to be set
directly if it should be used. Anyone not generating it will get a
deprecation warning from cinder but it will still work for now.q

Change-Id: Icdbcb98586c09d6e2a803fca91c1566dfd69134a

commit_message:
Support identity_uri and auth_uri properly and add auth_version option

This change aligns this module with others like heat, neutron, et al, by
not automatically generating identity_uri and forcing it to be set
directly if it should be used. Anyone not generating it will get a
deprecation warning from cinder but it will still work for now.q

Change-Id: Icdbcb98586c09d6e2a803fca91c1566dfd69134a

commit_message:
Add hiera calls to allow management of ports and protocols

This allows for the definition of ports and protocols (http vs https) to be
offloaded to the HEAT templates ( https://review.openstack.org/231930 ) and avoids
hard coding the port numbers for exposed ports

Change-Id: I1bbaa6fa7a3e9a7eea00d6771bb1be3c5bf6a15e
Depends-On: I0ba8e38d75a0c628d8132a66dc25a30fc5183c79

commit_message:
Support refreshing endpoints

When a service is updated it is actually deleted and recreated.  This
has the side effect of deleting the endpoints for that service.

This change subscribes the endpoints to the service and adds support
for "refresh" so that when services are modified the endpoints are
replaced.

Change-Id: Ibcd209a672797e68edd749e4b781625eb1eb551f
Closes-Bug: 1514795

Change-Id: I81ad177d72882e2c6f11c5d3c45389dcee296b59

commit_message:
Add ability to specify interface to floating IP Pools.

  - This adds the abiluty to specify a specific
    interface to put floating IPs on. This is especially
    useful when those interfaces are VLANed as it allows
    for complete speration of tenants all the way through
    to the floating NAT layer. Note: To have this honered
    you must set external_interface to empty or False so
    that this condition is triggeredin nova/network/floating_ips.py:
    'interface = CONF.public_interface or floating_ip.interface'

Change-Id: I81ad177d72882e2c6f11c5d3c45389dcee296b59

commit_message:
Introduce 'log_aggregation_source' resource

This resource is intended to help with setting up log aggregation.
It defines a fluentd source which tails the give source path,
and adds some metadata to resulting log entries.

Depends-On: Ib739de0ca70b8f85c0b4fb3c9ea57fd9c2b0fa61
Change-Id: I87524bc81621d7a1c4a1ab8f7c6ac049b1443371

commit_message:
Resource keystone_trust for Keystone V3 API

[WIP] Acceptance tests still failing:
      When manipulating trusts, the credentials of the trustor are needed
      Troubleshooting why the ENV context is not working...

With Keystone API V3 support the trust capability is now available as keystone
custom type/provider by implementing [1].

Trust are uniquely identify by the ID (see Note: Trusts are unique only by their
ID).

Therefore the keystone_trust resource title is meaningless. Once created, the
trust ID is used for the resource name.

By design trusts cannot be modified, trying to do so via the puppet provider
will raise an error.

Manifest example:

  keystone_trust {'adminv3 trust user1':
    trustor_user   => 'adminv3',
    trustor_domain => 'admin_domain',
    trustee_user   => 'user1',
    trustee_domain => 'admin_domain',
    project        => 'openstackv3',
    project_domain => 'admin_domain',
    roles          => ['admin','operator'],
    impersonate    => true,
    ensure         => present
  }

To delete a trust:

  keystone_trust {'0ae2d20042d6418b8f3b8832ab43360e': ensure => absent}

Note: Trusts are unique only by their ID.
Effectively, several trusts with the same properties can exists:

  $ trust create adminv3 user1 --role admin --project openstackv3 -f shell
  deleted_at="None"
  expires_at="None"
  id="00cf1f149fd0463994ad62ec0939ec71"
  impersonation="False"
  project_id="cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d"
  redelegation_count="0"
  remaining_uses="None"
  roles="admin"
  trustee_user_id="e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17"
  trustor_user_id="b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"

  $ trust create adminv3 user1 --role admin --project openstackv3 -f shell
  deleted_at="None"
  expires_at="None"
  id="0ae2d20042d6418b8f3b8832ab43360e"
  impersonation="False"
  project_id="cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d"
  redelegation_count="0"
  remaining_uses="None"
  roles="admin"
  trustee_user_id="e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17"
  trustor_user_id="b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"

  $ openstack trust list -f csv
  "ID","Expires At","Impersonation","Project ID","Trustee User ID","Trustor User ID"
  "00cf1f149fd0463994ad62ec0939ec71","",False,"cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d","e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17","b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"
  "0ae2d20042d6418b8f3b8832ab43360e","",False,"cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d","e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17","b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"

  $ openstack trust show 00cf1f149fd0463994ad62ec0939ec71 -f shell
  deleted_at="None"
  expires_at="None"
  id="00cf1f149fd0463994ad62ec0939ec71"
  impersonation="False"
  project_id="cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d"
  redelegation_count="0"
  remaining_uses="None"
  roles="admin"
  trustee_user_id="e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17"
  trustor_user_id="b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"

  $ openstack trust show 0ae2d20042d6418b8f3b8832ab43360e -f shell
  deleted_at="None"
  expires_at="None"
  id="0ae2d20042d6418b8f3b8832ab43360e"
  impersonation="False"
  project_id="cf31bbe1ab4e4135a83b1b923d733b0d"
  redelegation_count="0"
  remaining_uses="None"
  roles="admin"
  trustee_user_id="e057d0ac9c394f5c833c6a746d76bc17"
  trustor_user_id="b0fa819e150a4005a10ebdfc9d1b97d4"

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/api/v3/identity-api-v3-os-trust-ext.html

commit_message:
Setup SELinux booleans if running in httpd

SELinux booleans httpd_use_openstack and httpd_can_network_connect_db
need to be turned on in order to have keystone working with httpd on
SELinux enabled systems.

Change-Id: I8722a4e619ac0d0a9e534e34721409d72e5c8323

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-11 23:07:59.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/glance_image_spec.rb', 'manifests/registry.pp', 'spec/unit/provider/glance_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance_image/openstack.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/acceptance/basic_glance_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/glance.rb', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': "support for keystone v3 api - glance

Implements blueprint api-v3-support

This patch does the following:
1) This implements support for the Keystone v3 api in glance,
using the openstack provider.  Note: Does not use the v3 identity
api - the base openstack provider will use v2 or v3 depending on
the authentication parameters provided.  The auth url should not
have /v2.0 or /v3.
2) Uses the new keystone_authtoken auth_plugin 'password'.  This
allows the glance services to use Keystone v3 password based
authentication.  The glance api and registry classes have been changed
to set the required parameters in the keystone_authtoken section of
the config files, using the keystone::resource::authtoken resource.
The classes have been changed to accept user and project domains
corresponding to the auth user and tenant.  You can also pass in a
single default domain which will apply to both the user and the
tenant.
3) Uses the new keystone::resource::authtoken resource to manage
the keystone_authtoken section in the config files.
4) Allows glance to provide user domain, project domain, and default
domain parameters to resources and classes that are domain aware.

Change-Id: Ia7474b966b51c89050049178062e9f9aef55667a
Depends-On: I4715464ce37dbd287a2700b8cf05705b7d307b50
"}]
commit_message:
support for keystone v3 api - glance

Implements blueprint api-v3-support

This patch does the following:
1) This implements support for the Keystone v3 api in glance,
using the openstack provider.  Note: Does not use the v3 identity
api - the base openstack provider will use v2 or v3 depending on
the authentication parameters provided.  The auth url should not
have /v2.0 or /v3.
2) Uses the new keystone_authtoken auth_plugin 'password'.  This
allows the glance services to use Keystone v3 password based
authentication.  The glance api and registry classes have been changed
to set the required parameters in the keystone_authtoken section of
the config files, using the keystone::resource::authtoken resource.
The classes have been changed to accept user and project domains
corresponding to the auth user and tenant.  You can also pass in a
single default domain which will apply to both the user and the
tenant.
3) Uses the new keystone::resource::authtoken resource to manage
the keystone_authtoken section in the config files.
4) Allows glance to provide user domain, project domain, and default
domain parameters to resources and classes that are domain aware.

Change-Id: Ia7474b966b51c89050049178062e9f9aef55667a
Depends-On: I4715464ce37dbd287a2700b8cf05705b7d307b50

Separate container sync setting

Add swift::storage::container_sync class to set up the
$allowed_sync_hosts variable, so that user can use
swift::storage::all class to set up storage node.

Implements: blueprint separate-container-sync-setting

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11302, 'name': 'Phillip Toohill', 'email': 'phillip.toohill@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ptoohill1'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 14591, 'name': 'Lubosz Kosnik (diltram)', 'email': 'lubosz.kosnik@intel.com', 'username': 'diltram'}, {'_account_id': 16923, 'name': 'HP Octavia Sonar CI', 'email': 'octavia.sonar@gmail.com', 'username': 'octaviasonar', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18462, 'name': 'Rahul U Nair', 'email': 'rahulunair@gmail.com', 'username': 'rahulunair'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 01:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/data_models.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: Ieb6d270b92c43210f3787b18441f19faa2180d17
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: Ieb6d270b92c43210f3787b18441f19faa2180d17

Update image_properties within the 'Upload images to Glance' task to use

library has been updated to properly deserialize the resulting YAML
string.

Change-Id: Ie4e7d0b25ada44c8ba9aeffa48d6227a2c2d4f62

commit_message:
Update image_properties in image upload task

Glance requires that the passed image properties be an iterable
dictionary.

Update image_properties within the 'Upload images to Glance' task to use
YAML's syntax for a dictionary instead of a JSON string. The glance
library has been updated to properly deserialize the resulting YAML
string.

Change-Id: Ie4e7d0b25ada44c8ba9aeffa48d6227a2c2d4f62
Depends-On: I2f02a4e772398d0c133d3109058d55c4f96b72f7

The identity tests used to create network resources but they are not

Note: somehow security groups are still created and deleted. One can

Closes-Bug: #1618519
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create network resources for identity tests

The identity tests used to create network resources but they are not
needed because we are testing the Identity service. This patch
stops creating these network resources.

Note: somehow security groups are still created and deleted. One can
look Neutron server's log while running the identiy tests to see this.

Change-Id: Ie77d8ecff5f346ed9411192d7076c321a9a22929
Closes-Bug: #1618519

subject: Rabbit policies now overrideable by deployers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 16:32:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-rabbitmq-server-functional.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/policy-override-522df5699f09c417.yaml', 'tasks/rabbitmq_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Rabbit policies now overrideable by deployers

Previously the role assumed that all deployers wanted
all queues to be HA. Performance testing by Mirantis and
Intel has suggested that throughput increases can be dramatic
when disabling HA queues, see:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/performance-docs/test_results/mq/rabbitmq/index.html

Therefore, we should allow deployers to set their own
policies when desired.

Change-Id: I156b8618e78d74823ec568053157afc853baad84
Closes-Bug: #1607830
'}]
commit_message:
Rabbit policies now overrideable by deployers

Previously the role assumed that all deployers wanted
all queues to be HA. Performance testing by Mirantis and
Intel has suggested that throughput increases can be dramatic
when disabling HA queues, see:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/performance-docs/test_results/mq/rabbitmq/index.html

Therefore, we should allow deployers to set their own
policies when desired.

Change-Id: I156b8618e78d74823ec568053157afc853baad84
Closes-Bug: #1607830

commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: Ia63ebf075edeb3aec03c7968efc8ae452a94696b
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Add a note about microversion testing schema gaps

As discussed at the nova newton midcycle and in the dev list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099860.html

This adds a note about needing to add tests for microversion changes
to response schema after feature freeze each release so we don't
have a big gap in coverage.

Change-Id: Iec60a08dc8a76943962ba90329155f9a0ca22f42

commit_message:
Configure Cobbler's Apache with reqtimeout module

This change adds the reqtimeout module to the Cobbler's Apache
configuration to reduce the risk of timeouts on large clusters.

Related-Bug: #1608700
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

subject: Change Kolla jobs to 90 minutes for short term
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 16:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/kolla.yaml'], 'message': "Change Kolla jobs to 90 minutes for short term

We are struggling to get mirrors added to openstack-infra because
I believe it is a manual proces and reviews are stalling out waiting
on internal openstack-infra training.  I realize its the end of the
cycle and everyone in openstack-infra is working 18x7, so rather then
fix this properly now (with mirrors which solves the problem) I'd like
to extend our gate timer to 90 minutes for our centos jobs which are
much slower becaue of a lack of mirrors for our dependent software
packages.

Removing bindep install helped 2 minutes - but that isn't enough.  The
reason this has reared its ugly head is likely because we have twice
as many containers in Newton as we had in Mitaka - which puts the build
time at 45 minutes in the gate.

I will follow this up with a stacked review of mirroring for our
repos in Kolla for CentOS (where the gates are failing) in early
Ocata.

Change-Id: If4fbbd84e49e851f3ddac48595a8d8b72ff69db5
"}]
commit_message:
Change Kolla jobs to 90 minutes for short term

We are struggling to get mirrors added to openstack-infra because
I believe it is a manual proces and reviews are stalling out waiting
on internal openstack-infra training.  I realize its the end of the
cycle and everyone in openstack-infra is working 18x7, so rather then
fix this properly now (with mirrors which solves the problem) I'd like
to extend our gate timer to 90 minutes for our centos jobs which are
much slower becaue of a lack of mirrors for our dependent software
packages.

Removing bindep install helped 2 minutes - but that isn't enough.  The
reason this has reared its ugly head is likely because we have twice
as many containers in Newton as we had in Mitaka - which puts the build
time at 45 minutes in the gate.

I will follow this up with a stacked review of mirroring for our
repos in Kolla for CentOS (where the gates are failing) in early
Ocata.

Change-Id: If4fbbd84e49e851f3ddac48595a8d8b72ff69db5

subject: Improve security rule notification message
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-27 17:57:31.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py'], 'message': 'Improve security rule notification message

If from_port and to_port are both "-1" then return "any port"
instead of "-1:-1". For example, instead of
	``ALLOW -1:-1/icmp from 0.0.0.0/0``
return
	``ALLOW any port/icmp from 0.0.0.0/0``

Change-Id: I0ded50a40089406fd69c8fa869839e46eecef352
Closes-Bug: #1430005
'}]
commit_message:
Improve security rule notification message

If from_port and to_port are both "-1" then return "any port"
instead of "-1:-1". For example, instead of
	``ALLOW -1:-1/icmp from 0.0.0.0/0``
return
	``ALLOW any port/icmp from 0.0.0.0/0``

Change-Id: I0ded50a40089406fd69c8fa869839e46eecef352
Closes-Bug: #1430005

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-07 17:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Default nova cpu allocation ratio to 4.0

The default cpu allocation ratio in nova is 0.0, which means no
overcommit. This is good for production, but not really for developers
and the gate. Since we don't have CoreFilter enabled by default, people
don't notice that the scheduler is technically overcommitting our
cpus, against the advice of this config.

Since this value is used in the brave new world order of resource
providers, we're getting warnings (which will be errors later) because
the non-resource-provider scheduler is overcommitting things. By
defaulting this to something sane for developers and the gate, we
avoid these warnings, and later errors.

Change-Id: If222f7f12fcddc3dc03ebf78b546fed51b6e8a81
"}]
commit_message:
Default nova cpu allocation ratio to 4.0

The default cpu allocation ratio in nova is 0.0, which means no
overcommit. This is good for production, but not really for developers
and the gate. Since we don't have CoreFilter enabled by default, people
don't notice that the scheduler is technically overcommitting our
cpus, against the advice of this config.

Since this value is used in the brave new world order of resource
providers, we're getting warnings (which will be errors later) because
the non-resource-provider scheduler is overcommitting things. By
defaulting this to something sane for developers and the gate, we
avoid these warnings, and later errors.

Change-Id: If222f7f12fcddc3dc03ebf78b546fed51b6e8a81

commit_message:
Handle exception when comparing of MACs fails in check_dhcp_resp

In case MAC's value is empty string comparing utils.is_same_mac fails
with ValueError exception which may leads to responses from other nodes not
being processed. We need to properly handle such situation.

Change-Id: I8843f9eabd139222ac326fdc26a43f5702ba751b
Related-Bug: #1569339
Related-Bug: #1569325
(cherry picked from commit 51690232dec6a6653235ecfb5b2352b1c09abd09)

subject: Rename collected logs for easier CI viewing
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-09-07 16:55:28.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Rename collected logs for easier CI viewing

OpenStack-CI facilitates the ability to view compressed
files on the log server if they have the suffix .txt.gz.

This patch ensures that all collected log files are renamed
to have a .txt suffix before compressing them.

The following changes are also made:
- The bindep file is also cleaned up a little to reduce
  unnecessary duplication.
- PYTHONUNBUFFERED is set to ensure that the console log
  from the CI jobs are in the exact order of execution.

Change-Id: I89f5734275dc2789f44b5bd9c0b45dc34c4a7a50
'}]
commit_message:
Rename collected logs for easier CI viewing

OpenStack-CI facilitates the ability to view compressed
files on the log server if they have the suffix .txt.gz.

This patch ensures that all collected log files are renamed
to have a .txt suffix before compressing them.

The following changes are also made:
- The bindep file is also cleaned up a little to reduce
  unnecessary duplication.
- PYTHONUNBUFFERED is set to ensure that the console log
  from the CI jobs are in the exact order of execution.

Change-Id: I89f5734275dc2789f44b5bd9c0b45dc34c4a7a50

commit_message:
Increasing the timeout value for kolla jobs

We have more images to build in gate. 1 hour is not enough any more.
Lots of jobs failed with timeout error. Increasing the timeout to 2
hour.

Change-Id: I15941657f7db70592baf68b42919cb753f98091e
Signed-off-by: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>

subject: [api-ref] Correcting parameter's type
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}, {'_account_id': 15471, 'name': 'Nguyen Phuong An', 'email': 'annp.cs51@gmail.com', 'username': 'An-FVL'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-06 04:19:24.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3-ext/federation/identity-provider/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v2-admin/admin-endpoints_parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3-ext/federation/mapping/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3-ext/federation/service-provider/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3-ext/parameters.yaml'], 'message': "[api-ref] Correcting parameter's type

This patch corrects some parameter's type such as 'type: list'
to 'type: array' or 'type: array of...' to 'type: array' because we
don't have 'type: list' in 'JSON Schema primitive types' [1]

[1] http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-core.html#anchor8

Change-Id: Ic638ef48fcf0f60c55cec975ee20a71d1830b319
"}]
commit_message:
[api-ref] Correcting parameter's type

This patch corrects some parameter's type such as 'type: list'
to 'type: array' or 'type: array of...' to 'type: array' because we
don't have 'type: list' in 'JSON Schema primitive types' [1]

[1] http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-core.html#anchor8

Change-Id: Ic638ef48fcf0f60c55cec975ee20a71d1830b319

commit_message:
VNFFG  abstract driver

Implements: blueprint tacker-vnffg

Abstract driver interface for VNFFG.  Driver implementation should be
done in this same folder, then inherited into respective VIM driver.

Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

after batch delete action.

commit_message:
Add test to ensure that directories are not empty

The scp command will fail if the directory in the preceeding for
loop is empty.  This adds a test to ensure that $i is acutally a
file name.

Change-Id: Ib2a3c929a7a15b290c2cf09c05d4079a1ec8c6e6
Closes-Bug: #1621160

subject: Deserialize glance image_properties
