Glance requires that the passed image properties be an iterable
dictionary.

Update the documented example to use YAML's syntax for a dictionary
instead of a JSON string. The resulting string will be deserialized
to a Python dict.

Change-Id: I2f02a4e772398d0c133d3109058d55c4f96b72f7
"}]
commit_message:
Deserialize glance image_properties

Glance requires that the passed image properties be an iterable
dictionary.

Update the documented example to use YAML's syntax for a dictionary
instead of a JSON string. The resulting string will be deserialized
to a Python dict.

Change-Id: I2f02a4e772398d0c133d3109058d55c4f96b72f7

Fix a "Failed to merge schema" corner case by removing
mnesia files, if a node can't be gracefully reset.
Force_reset doesn't clean schema it seems and cannot be
trusted.

Upstream PR https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/945
Closes-bug: 1620649

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Skip rabbit force_reset and erase mnesia files

Fix a "Failed to merge schema" corner case by removing
mnesia files, if a node can't be gracefully reset.
Force_reset doesn't clean schema it seems and cannot be
trusted.

Upstream PR https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/945
Closes-bug: 1620649

Change-Id: Id918061d6b2d8dea612807158cec791cb2bad10e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

subject: failed to start freezer-scheduler
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11151, 'name': 'Fausto Marzi', 'email': 'fausto.marzi@ericsson.com', 'username': 'fausto.marzi'}, {'_account_id': 12512, 'name': 'Deklan Dieterly', 'email': 'deklan.dieterly@hpe.com', 'username': 'deklan'}, {'_account_id': 14101, 'name': 'yapeng Yang', 'email': 'a394954369@gmail.com', 'username': 'yapeng'}, {'_account_id': 14159, 'name': 'Fabrizio Vanni', 'email': 'fabrizio.vanni@hpe.com', 'username': 'fabrizio.vanni'}, {'_account_id': 14340, 'name': 'Memo Garcia', 'email': 'guillermo.ramirez-garcia@hp.com', 'username': 'memogarcia'}, {'_account_id': 15358, 'name': 'Eldar Nugaev', 'email': 'eldar.nugaev@hp.com', 'username': 'eldar'}, {'_account_id': 21644, 'name': 'Shangzhong Zhu', 'email': 'zhu.shangzhong@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'shangzhong.zhu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-29 09:17:31.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/scheduler/arguments.py', 'freezer/scheduler/freezer_scheduler.py', 'tests/unit/scheduler/test_scheduler_daemon.py', 'freezer/scheduler/daemon.py'], 'message': 'failed to start freezer-scheduler

Edit the /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf file and
complete the following actions:
log_file = scheduler.log
log_dir = /home/tmp
use_stderr = false
no_api = true

start freezer-scheduler:
The freezer-scheduler isn't started successfully.

When start freezer-scheduler, the CONF.log_dir + CONF.log_file should
be passed to daemon.start() as parameter. Currently, the only
CONF.log_file was passed to. In the file daemon.py, the file name will
be passed to setup_logging()->configure_logging(). In the function
configure_logging(), the variable "expanded_dir_name" will be set as
"empty". So the exception was raised when creating directory to
use utils.create_dir(). The freezer-scheduler process will be aborted.

In the freezer-scheduler module, there are 2 setup_logging() funtions.
The one is in the arguments.py, the another is in the daemon.py.
The Python standard logging library is being used in the daemon.py.
We should use oslo_log instead of the logging. And the setup_logging()
in the daemon.py should be removed.

When the oslo_log is used to record the log, The freezer-scheduler
daemon can be started successfully.

Change-Id: I397cedf782d86548e7dc8bc5efc6caae9163cbd9
Partial-Bug: #1610904
'}]
commit_message:
failed to start freezer-scheduler

Edit the /etc/freezer/scheduler.conf file and
complete the following actions:
log_file = scheduler.log
log_dir = /home/tmp
use_stderr = false
no_api = true

start freezer-scheduler:
The freezer-scheduler isn't started successfully.

When start freezer-scheduler, the CONF.log_dir + CONF.log_file should
be passed to daemon.start() as parameter. Currently, the only
CONF.log_file was passed to. In the file daemon.py, the file name will
be passed to setup_logging()->configure_logging(). In the function
configure_logging(), the variable "expanded_dir_name" will be set as
"empty". So the exception was raised when creating directory to
use utils.create_dir(). The freezer-scheduler process will be aborted.

In the freezer-scheduler module, there are 2 setup_logging() funtions.
The one is in the arguments.py, the another is in the daemon.py.
The Python standard logging library is being used in the daemon.py.
We should use oslo_log instead of the logging. And the setup_logging()
in the daemon.py should be removed.

When the oslo_log is used to record the log, The freezer-scheduler
daemon can be started successfully.

Change-Id: I397cedf782d86548e7dc8bc5efc6caae9163cbd9
Partial-Bug: #1610904

remove the old endpoint from Keystone, and automatically chose a dash or
underscore based on driver type used.

'}]
commit_message:
Update murano service name

In Mitaka, the service name must have a dash rather than underscore when using
the sql catalog driver in Keystone[0] (the default).

This works for upgrade also, though further improvements could be written to
remove the old endpoint from Keystone, and automatically chose a dash or
underscore based on driver type used.

[0] http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/murano/mitaka.html#upgrade-notes

Change-Id: I15a03370afdad6529eec51a206b6134bf80b283d
Closes-Bug: 1576152
(cherry picked from commit d9fc4c6f40d00232a4d61a1b594723376d210f78)

commit_message:
Ensure doesn't use LOG.warn

This patchs ensure doesn't use LOG.warn because LOG.warn deprecated
in Python 3 [1]. Using LOG.warning should be used instead.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I464314b33b8d4f31b6be0a765019e1f5668cc6d9

Right now heat can support convergence mode, means we will give it

open. The number of queues keep growing by repeat above action.

commit_message:
Add RabbitMQ expiration policies for convergence

Right now heat can support convergence mode, means we will give it
chances to raise bug 1599104. We simply add policies for worker queues.
This fix services with interruption signal and leave the target queues
open. The number of queues keep growing by repeat above action.
This patch add a expiration for queues. allow queues to be close as
long as they didn't been used for a long period of time(1 hour).
This fix must solve problem with growing number of RabbitMQ queues.

Change-Id: Icda32000f391780c4e3d5d3ebcc519bf853283b7
Related-Bug: #1599104
(cherry picked from commit 46eed2a513518b34d26edb869c1710b91650add1)

commit_message:
Disable DAC change auditing

This patch disables all of the discretionary access control (DAC)
auditing in auditd. This should reduce the volume of logs created
during deployments and during OpenStack CI jobs.

The patch also corrects an incorrect key in the audit logs for
V-38568.

Manual backport of I193f739647cfb7d0ce395984b51867bf6bd46cd8.

Closes-Bug: 1620849
Change-Id: Iaa64207df40dffe1ae22e018246096869b603036

commit_message:
Skip pulling cinder information if cinder api is unavailable

Now if user wants create node group template
and cinder is unavailable, dashboard send
error message: "Unable to retrive volumes type
list".
We can skip pulling cinder information if it's
unavailable and show only one option to "storage
location" field: "Ephemeral Drive".

Change-Id: I53907be435f2c4290adb07d0ec0a2c121c9b890a
Closes-bug: 1524432

subject: Fix translation of exceptions
revisions:

Functional tests that caused exceptions were getting handled
incorrectly. This patch borrows from Glance to correct the way webob
exceptions are translated and allows checking of status codes (i.e.
  self.assertEqual(403, response.status)

Change-Id: I76b5858bc9a1bf73cd92d6ddf76c7e4c065fad72
Closes-Bug: #1610398
'}]
commit_message:
Fix translation of exceptions

Functional tests that caused exceptions were getting handled
incorrectly. This patch borrows from Glance to correct the way webob
exceptions are translated and allows checking of status codes (i.e.
  self.assertEqual(403, response.status)

Change-Id: I76b5858bc9a1bf73cd92d6ddf76c7e4c065fad72
Closes-Bug: #1610398

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-06 23:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Generate Keystone credentials for overcloud

Keystone recently forced users to generate Keystone credentials in
/etc/keystone. The generation of credential can be done by
keystone-manage tool but it would require to do it on one node, export
the key into a storage system and collect the key on keystone servers.

This approach will generate a uniq Keystone credential key and export
two parameters: KeystoneCredential0 and KeystoneCredential1 that we will
use in puppet-keystone and Hiera to define the static content of the
keys.

It will allow us to do multinode deployments with the same keys.

support rotations yet.

Change-Id: Ibca678b8bf222ecdef6615e34553598be3e55bf0
"}]
commit_message:
Generate Keystone credentials for overcloud

Keystone recently forced users to generate Keystone credentials in
/etc/keystone. The generation of credential can be done by
keystone-manage tool but it would require to do it on one node, export
the key into a storage system and collect the key on keystone servers.

This approach will generate a uniq Keystone credential key and export
two parameters: KeystoneCredential0 and KeystoneCredential1 that we will
use in puppet-keystone and Hiera to define the static content of the
keys.

It will allow us to do multinode deployments with the same keys.

This is a first iteration of Keystone credential supports. It doesn't
support rotations yet.

Change-Id: Ibca678b8bf222ecdef6615e34553598be3e55bf0

commit_message:
Add support to re-assign a set of nodes

This patch adds an ability to re-assign a set of the given nodes at
once. This feature was technically available but not exposed to the
client. A groupped re-assigning allows to effectively re-provision nodes
by creating an atomic task in Astute.

Change-Id: I4a7c7e35d844683ef73ad7f8459d1892e80e0a64
Related-Bug: #1616925

commit_message:
Disable DAC change auditing

This patch disables all of the discretionary access control (DAC)
auditing in auditd. This should reduce the volume of logs created
during deployments and during OpenStack CI jobs.

The patch also corrects an incorrect key in the audit logs for
V-38568.

Closes-Bug: 1620849
Change-Id: I193f739647cfb7d0ce395984b51867bf6bd46cd8

commit_message:
Collect compressed logs after functional test execution

This change enables log collection within the gate so that further
analysis on gate tasks can be performed post build. This is very
useful when debugging problems and also for investigating the
consequences of patches once they've been tested.

Related-Bug: #1620849
Change-Id: I2bb923ebcd73114c1199b14f9b769435596091eb

subject: Allow the validations to run openstack commands
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 07:44:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-validation'], 'message': 'Allow the validations to run openstack commands

The "run_validation" mistral action passes the necessary credentials to
authenticate against the undercloud OpenStack, but they're not in the
format the openstack commandline client expects, which means that e.g.
running "openstack server list" from the validation would fail.

This sets the necessary environment variables such that the commands
should mostly just work.

Change-Id: Ie09a68bdcd8107399558f45f022480ef066e8c01
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the validations to run openstack commands

The "run_validation" mistral action passes the necessary credentials to
authenticate against the undercloud OpenStack, but they're not in the
format the openstack commandline client expects, which means that e.g.
running "openstack server list" from the validation would fail.

This sets the necessary environment variables such that the commands
should mostly just work.

Change-Id: Ie09a68bdcd8107399558f45f022480ef066e8c01

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 23:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'specs/newton/standardize-context-arguments.rst'], 'message': 'Standardize Context Arguments spec

Provide a cross-project consistency when using and subclassing the
oslo.context RequestContext class by standardizing on:

* user is to be identified as user_id
* tenant is to be identified as project_id
* domain is to be identified as domain_id
* user_domain to be identied as user_domain_id
* project_domain to be identied as project_domain_id

Change-Id: I16e8d1e017cc58d9238b7358875d7f3f12e4fe6a
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize Context Arguments spec

Provide a cross-project consistency when using and subclassing the
oslo.context RequestContext class by standardizing on:

* user is to be identified as user_id
* tenant is to be identified as project_id
* domain is to be identified as domain_id
* user_domain to be identied as user_domain_id
* project_domain to be identied as project_domain_id

Change-Id: I16e8d1e017cc58d9238b7358875d7f3f12e4fe6a

commit_message:
[WIP] Add policy for managing deprecation

Document the use of deprecation of Olso features and the Oslo
libraries that can be used to deprecate project functionality.

This policy defines usage for:
* Deprecation of configuration options
* Use of versionutils
* Use of debtcollector
Change-Id: Ifb22c47f38adedc286b7e2fa35903e1de593a425

commit_message:
Add new test 'shutdown_non_primary_controller_ceph'

Scenario:
1. Pre-condition - do steps from 'deploy_ha_ceph' test
2. Create 1 instance
3. Set floating IP associated with created instance
4. Shut down non primary controller
5. Wait for HA services to be ready
6. Verify networks
7. Ensure connectivity to external resources from VM
8. Run OSTF tests

Related blueprint run-fuel-qa-on-baremetal

Change-Id: I55a8a9e908b52407d3892bba626883146404154a

commit_message:
[zmq] Make ThreadingPoller work with ZmqSocket

This patch makes zmq-driver-pollers work only with
zmq-driver-sockets since the lower-level zmq-socket class
have to be used only as an underlying implementation
for the higher-level zmq-driver-socket class.

Change-Id: Icb6fe89a3af7af6760b724a313ad2a7fb2a106c7
Closes-Bug: #1620543

commit_message:
Improve network resolving for nova server

When resolving network information, it is likely that the network
specified cannot be retrieved or doesn't exist. Need to guard against
those conditions.

subject: Fix error when identity file is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 07:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/validations.py'], 'message': "Fix error when identity file is missing

When the ssh_keys mistral environment was not present or missing the
'private_key' variable the RunValidationAction would fail with
UnboundLocalError.

This commit makes sure the identity_file variable is assigned before
being referenced in the finally block.

Change-Id: I60507fb0589127ca7dd9e8490f14edf558e994e6
Closes-Bug: #1620476
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error when identity file is missing

When the ssh_keys mistral environment was not present or missing the
'private_key' variable the RunValidationAction would fail with
UnboundLocalError.

This commit makes sure the identity_file variable is assigned before
being referenced in the finally block.

Change-Id: I60507fb0589127ca7dd9e8490f14edf558e994e6
Closes-Bug: #1620476

subject: Support multi-phase access-network configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-07 07:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/nova_cc_context.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Support multi-phase access-network configuration

The introduction of the nova_api database in Mitaka broke support
for Percona Cluster deployed using the access-network configuration.

Ensure that a None return value from SharedDBContext is passed up
the call chain, indicating that the relation is currently incomplete
for the nova_api database; a later data set will complete the
relation.

Change-Id: I8b6a95832732ea7dd7d0f25ec63e403797359edb
Closes-Bug: 1618321
(cherry picked from commit 355617388a46c3e1edf82270175b1a01abf69ad5)
'}]
commit_message:
Support multi-phase access-network configuration

The introduction of the nova_api database in Mitaka broke support
for Percona Cluster deployed using the access-network configuration.

Ensure that a None return value from SharedDBContext is passed up
the call chain, indicating that the relation is currently incomplete
for the nova_api database; a later data set will complete the
relation.

Change-Id: I8b6a95832732ea7dd7d0f25ec63e403797359edb
Closes-Bug: 1618321
(cherry picked from commit 355617388a46c3e1edf82270175b1a01abf69ad5)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-04 13:16:51.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3'], 'message': 'Allows private v4 network to have a dns name server

The current devstack will not setup name server when create the
default private network, this patch will add the name server
so that developers can either set a dns name server using the
DNS_NAMESERVER in loca.conf or default value of 8.8.4.4

To use a specific name server, add a line in local.conf like
the following, replace 8.8.4.4 with your own dns server IP

DNS_NAMESERVER = 8.8.4.4

Change-Id: Id5b55651163da2c1cb3eebe581c28c71089f566f
'}]
commit_message:
Allows private v4 network to have a dns name server

The current devstack will not setup name server when create the
default private network, this patch will add the name server
so that developers can either set a dns name server using the
DNS_NAMESERVER in loca.conf or default value of 8.8.4.4

To use a specific name server, add a line in local.conf like
the following, replace 8.8.4.4 with your own dns server IP

DNS_NAMESERVER = 8.8.4.4

Change-Id: Id5b55651163da2c1cb3eebe581c28c71089f566f

subject: Reload ovs in kernal if install it from git
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-03 01:20:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/ovs_setup.sh'], 'message': "Reload ovs in kernal if install it from git

Install OVS from git won't update openvswitch module in kernel if it's
already loaded. As a result, the ct module fails to be loaded. This
patch try to unload openvswitch module manually, so that it can be
properly loaded in the following commands.

Update kernal and restart system can also fix the issue, but it is not
a good solution in fullstack env.

The code in this patch was added in [1] and removed in [2]. And the
reported issue can be observed since then.

[1] 47357e07a7d297964484ada9ca6755b18969a561
[2] dca34ff2f395fc0ac0136cac7b2d704c3c5a76cb

Co-Authored-By: yuanwei <wei.yuan@huawei.com>
Change-Id: I7acc8e224feb16b231770bb2c5c63340c9de89f3
Closes-Bug: #1619101
"}]
commit_message:
Reload ovs in kernal if install it from git

Install OVS from git won't update openvswitch module in kernel if it's
already loaded. As a result, the ct module fails to be loaded. This
patch try to unload openvswitch module manually, so that it can be
properly loaded in the following commands.

Update kernal and restart system can also fix the issue, but it is not
a good solution in fullstack env.

The code in this patch was added in [1] and removed in [2]. And the
reported issue can be observed since then.

[1] 47357e07a7d297964484ada9ca6755b18969a561
[2] dca34ff2f395fc0ac0136cac7b2d704c3c5a76cb

Co-Authored-By: yuanwei <wei.yuan@huawei.com>
Change-Id: I7acc8e224feb16b231770bb2c5c63340c9de89f3
Closes-Bug: #1619101
